source_text: Ich erkläre die am Freitag, dem 17. Dezember unterbrochene Sitzungsperiode des Europäischen Parlaments für wiederaufgenommen, wünsche Ihnen nochmals alles Gute zum Jahreswechsel und hoffe, daß Sie schöne Ferien hatten.
translated_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December, wish you once again all the best for the New Year and hope that you had a good holiday.
reference_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.

source_text: Ich erkläre die am Freitag, dem 17. Dezember unterbrochene Sitzungsperiode des Europäischen Parlaments für wiederaufgenommen, wünsche Ihnen nochmals alles Gute zum Jahreswechsel und hoffe, daß Sie schöne Ferien hatten.
translated_text: I declare the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday, 17 December, resumed. I once again wish you all the best for the New Year and hope you had a pleasant holiday.
reference_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.

source_text: Ich erkläre die am Freitag, dem 17. Dezember unterbrochene Sitzungsperiode des Europäischen Parlaments für wiederaufgenommen, wünsche Ihnen nochmals alles Gute zum Jahreswechsel und hoffe, daß Sie schöne Ferien hatten.
translated_text: I declare the session of the European Parliament, interrupted on Friday, 17 December, to be resumed, wish you once again all the best for the New Year and hope that you had a pleasant holiday.
reference_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.

source_text: Wie Sie feststellen konnten, ist der gefürchtete "Millenium-Bug " nicht eingetreten. Doch sind Bürger einiger unserer Mitgliedstaaten Opfer von schrecklichen Naturkatastrophen geworden.
translated_text: As you have seen, the dreaded "millennium bug" has not materialised. However, citizens of some of our member states have fallen victim to terrible natural disasters.
reference_text: Although, as you will have seen, the dreaded 'millennium bug' failed to materialise, still the people in a number of countries suffered a series of natural disasters that truly were dreadful.

source_text: Im Parlament besteht der Wunsch nach einer Aussprache im Verlauf dieser Sitzungsperiode in den nächsten Tagen.
translated_text: There is a desire in Parliament for a debate in the course of this session in the coming days.
reference_text: You have requested a debate on this subject in the course of the next few days, during this part-session.

source_text: Heute möchte ich Sie bitten - das ist auch der Wunsch einiger Kolleginnen und Kollegen -, allen Opfern der Stürme, insbesondere in den verschiedenen Ländern der Europäischen Union, in einer Schweigeminute zu gedenken.
translated_text: Today I would like to ask you - and this is also the wish of some of my colleagues - to observe a minute's silence in memory of all the victims of the storms, particularly in the various countries of the European Union.
reference_text: In the meantime, I should like to observe a minute' s silence, as a number of Members have requested, on behalf of all the victims concerned, particularly those of the terrible storms, in the various countries of the European Union.

source_text: Wie Sie sicher aus der Presse und dem Fernsehen wissen, gab es in Sri Lanka mehrere Bombenexplosionen mit zahlreichen Toten.
translated_text: As you probably know from the press and television, there have been several bomb explosions in Sri Lanka with numerous fatalities.
reference_text: You will be aware from the press and television that there have been a number of bomb explosions and killings in Sri Lanka.

translated_text: As you are surely aware from the press and television, there have been several bomb explosions in Sri Lanka with numerous fatalities.
reference_text: You will be aware from the press and television that there have been a number of bomb explosions and killings in Sri Lanka.

source_text: Zu den Attentatsopfern, die es in jüngster Zeit in Sri Lanka zu beklagen gab, zählt auch Herr Kumar Ponnambalam, der dem Europäischen Parlament erst vor wenigen Monaten einen Besuch abgestattet hatte.
translated_text: Mr Kumar Ponnambalam, who visited the European Parliament only a few months ago, is one of the recent victims of assassinations in Sri Lanka.
reference_text: One of the people assassinated very recently in Sri Lanka was Mr Kumar Ponnambalam, who had visited the European Parliament just a few months ago.

source_text: Zu den Attentatsopfern, die es in jüngster Zeit in Sri Lanka zu beklagen gab, zählt auch Herr Kumar Ponnambalam, der dem Europäischen Parlament erst vor wenigen Monaten einen Besuch abgestattet hatte.
translated_text: Among the recent victims of the attacks in Sri Lanka is Mr. Kumar Ponnambalam, who visited the European Parliament only a few months ago.

source_text: Zu den Attentatsopfern, die es in jüngster Zeit in Sri Lanka zu beklagen gab, zählt auch Herr Kumar Ponnambalam, der dem Europäischen Parlament erst vor wenigen Monaten einen Besuch abgestattet hatte.
translated_text: Among the victims of the recent attacks in Sri Lanka is Mr Kumar Ponnambalam, who visited the European Parliament just a few months ago.
reference_text: One of the people assassinated very recently in Sri Lanka was Mr Kumar Ponnambalam, who had visited the European Parliament just a few months ago.

source_text: Wäre es angemessen, wenn Sie, Frau Präsidentin, der Präsidentin von Sri Lanka in einem Schreiben das Bedauern des Parlaments zum gewaltsamen Tod von Herrn Ponnambalam und anderen Bürgern von Sri Lanka übermitteln und sie auffordern würden, alles in ihrem Kräften stehende zu tun, um nach einer friedlichen Lösung dieser sehr schwierigen Situation zu suchen?
translated_text: Would it be appropriate for you, Madam President, to write to the President of Sri Lanka expressing Parliament's regret at the violent death of Mr Ponnambalam and other Sri Lankans and urging her to do all she can to seek a peaceful solution to this very difficult situation?
reference_text: Would it be appropriate for you, Madam President, to write a letter to the Sri Lankan President expressing Parliament's regret at his and the other violent deaths in Sri Lanka and urging her to do everything she possibly can to seek a peaceful reconciliation to a very difficult situation?

source_text: Wäre es angemessen, wenn Sie, Frau Präsidentin, der Präsidentin von Sri Lanka in einem Schreiben das Bedauern des Parlaments zum gewaltsamen Tod von Herrn Ponnambalam und anderen Bürgern von Sri Lanka übermitteln und sie auffordern würden, alles in ihrem Kräften stehende zu tun, um nach einer friedlichen Lösung dieser sehr schwierigen Situation zu suchen?
translated_text: Would it be appropriate for you, Madam President, to write to the President of Sri Lanka conveying Parliament's regret at the violent death of Mr. Ponnambalam and other Sri Lankan citizens, and urging her to do everything in her power to seek a peaceful resolution to this very difficult situation?

translated_text: Would it be appropriate, Madam President, for you to write to the President of Sri Lanka to convey to her the Parliament's regret at the violent death of Mr Ponnambalam and other citizens of Sri Lanka and to ask her to do everything in her power to seek a peaceful solution to this very difficult situation?

source_text: Meine Frage betrifft eine Angelegenheit, die am Donnerstag zur Sprache kommen wird und auf die ich dann erneut verweisen werde.
translated_text: My question concerns a matter that will be raised on Thursday and to which I will then refer again.
reference_text: My question relates to something that will come up on Thursday and which I will then raise again.

source_text: Das Parlament wird sich am Donnerstag mit dem Cunha-Bericht über mehrjährige Ausrichtungsprogramme befassen, der in Absatz 6 vorschlägt, daß Länder, die ihr Soll zur Flottenverkleinerung nicht erfüllen, jährlich mit einer Art Quotenstrafe belegt werden sollen.
translated_text: On Thursday, Parliament will discuss the Cunha report on multi-annual guidance programmes, paragraph 6 of which proposes that countries that do not meet their fleet reduction targets should be subject to a kind of annual quota penalty.
reference_text: The Cunha report on multiannual guidance programmes comes before Parliament on Thursday and contains a proposal in paragraph 6 that a form of quota penalties should be introduced for countries which fail to meet their fleet reduction targets annually.

source_text: Das Parlament wird sich am Donnerstag mit dem Cunha-Bericht über mehrjährige Ausrichtungsprogramme befassen, der in Absatz 6 vorschlägt, daß Länder, die ihr Soll zur Flottenverkleinerung nicht erfüllen, jährlich mit einer Art Quotenstrafe belegt werden sollen.
translated_text: Parliament will discuss the Cunha report on multi-annual adjustment programmes on Thursday. Paragraph 6 of the report proposes that countries failing to meet their fleet reduction targets should be subject to an annual quota penalty.
reference_text: The Cunha report on multiannual guidance programmes comes before Parliament on Thursday and contains a proposal in paragraph 6 that a form of quota penalties should be introduced for countries which fail to meet their fleet reduction targets annually.

source_text: Das Parlament wird sich am Donnerstag mit dem Cunha-Bericht über mehrjährige Ausrichtungsprogramme befassen, der in Absatz 6 vorschlägt, daß Länder, die ihr Soll zur Flottenverkleinerung nicht erfüllen, jährlich mit einer Art Quotenstrafe belegt werden sollen.
translated_text: The Parliament will consider the Cunha report on multi-annual guidance programmes on Thursday, which suggests in paragraph 6 that countries which do not meet their fleet reduction targets should be subject to a form of quota penalty each year.
reference_text: The Cunha report on multiannual guidance programmes comes before Parliament on Thursday and contains a proposal in paragraph 6 that a form of quota penalties should be introduced for countries which fail to meet their fleet reduction targets annually.

source_text: Und zwar sollen derartige Strafen trotz des Grundsatzes der relativen Stabilität verhängt werden.
translated_text: Such penalties are to be imposed despite the principle of relative stability.
reference_text: It says that this should be done despite the principle of relative stability.

source_text: Und zwar sollen derartige Strafen trotz des Grundsatzes der relativen Stabilität verhängt werden.
translated_text: Such penalties should be imposed despite the principle of relative stability.

source_text: Und zwar sollen derartige Strafen trotz des Grundsatzes der relativen Stabilität verhängt werden.
translated_text: And indeed, such penalties are to be imposed despite the principle of relative stability.
reference_text: It says that this should be done despite the principle of relative stability.

source_text: Ich meine, daß der Grundsatz der relativen Stabilität einen elementaren Rechtsgrundsatz der gemeinsamen Fischereipolitik darstellt und ein Vorschlag, diesen zu unterlaufen, rechtlich unzulässig wäre.
translated_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental legal principle of the common fisheries policy and that a proposal to undermine it would be legally inadmissible.
reference_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental legal principle of the common fisheries policy and a proposal to subvert it would be legally inadmissible.

source_text: Ich meine, daß der Grundsatz der relativen Stabilität einen elementaren Rechtsgrundsatz der gemeinsamen Fischereipolitik darstellt und ein Vorschlag, diesen zu unterlaufen, rechtlich unzulässig wäre.
translated_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability constitutes a fundamental legal principle of the Common Fisheries Policy, and a proposal to circumvent it would be legally inadmissible.
reference_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental legal principle of the common fisheries policy and a proposal to subvert it would be legally inadmissible.

source_text: Ich meine, daß der Grundsatz der relativen Stabilität einen elementaren Rechtsgrundsatz der gemeinsamen Fischereipolitik darstellt und ein Vorschlag, diesen zu unterlaufen, rechtlich unzulässig wäre.
translated_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental principle of the common fisheries policy and that any proposal to undermine it would be legally inadmissible.
reference_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental legal principle of the common fisheries policy and a proposal to subvert it would be legally inadmissible.

source_text: Ich möchte wissen, ob es möglich ist, einen Einwand gegen ein Dokument zu erheben, bei dem es sich lediglich um einen Bericht und keinen Legislativvorschlag handelt, und ob ich befugt bin, dies am Donnerstag zu tun.
translated_text: I would like to know whether it is possible to raise an objection to a document that is merely a report and not a legislative proposal, and whether I am authorised to do so on Thursday.
reference_text: I want to know whether one can raise an objection of that kind to what is merely a report, not a legislative proposal, and whether that is something I can competently do on Thursday.

source_text: Ich möchte wissen, ob es möglich ist, einen Einwand gegen ein Dokument zu erheben, bei dem es sich lediglich um einen Bericht und keinen Legislativvorschlag handelt, und ob ich befugt bin, dies am Donnerstag zu tun.
translated_text: I would like to know if it is possible to raise an objection to a document that is merely a report and not a legislative proposal, and whether I am authorized to do so on Thursday.
reference_text: I want to know whether one can raise an objection of that kind to what is merely a report, not a legislative proposal, and whether that is something I can competently do on Thursday.

source_text: Ich möchte wissen, ob es möglich ist, einen Einwand gegen ein Dokument zu erheben, bei dem es sich lediglich um einen Bericht und keinen Legislativvorschlag handelt, und ob ich befugt bin, dies am Donnerstag zu tun.
translated_text: I would like to know if it is possible to raise an objection to a document that is merely a report and not a legislative proposal, and if I am entitled to do so on Thursday.
reference_text: I want to know whether one can raise an objection of that kind to what is merely a report, not a legislative proposal, and whether that is something I can competently do on Thursday.

source_text: Genau dann können Sie, wenn Sie wollen, diese Frage ansprechen, d. h. am Donnerstag zu Beginn der Aussprache über den Bericht.
translated_text: If you wish, you can raise this issue at that point, i.e. on Thursday at the beginning of the debate on the report.
reference_text: That is precisely the time when you may, if you wish, raise this question, i.e. on Thursday prior to the start of the presentation of the report.

source_text: Genau dann können Sie, wenn Sie wollen, diese Frage ansprechen, d. h. am Donnerstag zu Beginn der Aussprache über den Bericht.

reference_text: That is precisely the time when you may, if you wish, raise this question, i.e. on Thursday prior to the start of the presentation of the report.

source_text: Genau dann können Sie, wenn Sie wollen, diese Frage ansprechen, d. h. am Donnerstag zu Beginn der Aussprache über den Bericht.
translated_text: You can then, if you wish, raise this question, that is to say at the start of the debate on the report on Thursday.
reference_text: That is precisely the time when you may, if you wish, raise this question, i.e. on Thursday prior to the start of the presentation of the report.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin! Die erste diesjährige Tagung des Europäischen Parlaments fällt leider damit zusammen, daß in den Vereinigten Staaten, in Texas, für Donnerstag dieser Woche die Hinrichtung eines zum Tode verurteilten 34jährigen jungen Mannes namens Hicks festgelegt worden ist.
translated_text: Madam President, this year's first part-session of the European Parliament unfortunately coincides with the execution of a 34-year-old young man named Hicks, who has been sentenced to death, being scheduled for Thursday this week in the United States, in Texas.
reference_text: Madam President, coinciding with this year' s first part-session of the European Parliament, a date has been set, unfortunately for next Thursday, in Texas in America, for the execution of a young 34 year-old man who has been sentenced to death. We shall call him Mr Hicks.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin! Die erste diesjährige Tagung des Europäischen Parlaments fällt leider damit zusammen, daß in den Vereinigten Staaten, in Texas, für Donnerstag dieser Woche die Hinrichtung eines zum Tode verurteilten 34jährigen jungen Mannes namens Hicks festgelegt worden ist.
translated_text: Madam President, unfortunately, the first parliamentary session of this year coincides with the scheduled execution in Texas, USA, this Thursday, of a 34-year-old condemned man named Hicks.
reference_text: Madam President, coinciding with this year' s first part-session of the European Parliament, a date has been set, unfortunately for next Thursday, in Texas in America, for the execution of a young 34 year-old man who has been sentenced to death. We shall call him Mr Hicks.

translated_text: Madam President! The first session of the European Parliament this year unfortunately coincides with the fact that in the United States, in Texas, the execution of a 34-year-old young man named Hicks, who has been sentenced to death, has been scheduled for this Thursday.
reference_text: Madam President, coinciding with this year' s first part-session of the European Parliament, a date has been set, unfortunately for next Thursday, in Texas in America, for the execution of a young 34 year-old man who has been sentenced to death. We shall call him Mr Hicks.

source_text: Gemäß der vom Europäischen Parlament und von der gesamten Europäischen Union nunmehr ständig vertretenen Linie möchte ich Sie jedoch bitten, den ganzen Einfluß Ihres Amtes und der Institution, die Sie vertreten, bei dem Präsidentschaftskandidaten und Gouverneur von Texas, George W. Bush, der zur Aussetzung der Vollstreckung des Todesurteils und zur Begnadigung des Verurteilten befugt ist, geltend zu machen.
translated_text: However, in accordance with the line now consistently taken by the European Parliament and by the European Union as a whole, I would ask you to use all the influence of your office and of the institution you represent with the presidential candidate and Governor of Texas, George W. Bush, who is authorised to suspend the execution of the death sentence and to pardon the condemned man.
reference_text: However, I would ask you, in accordance with the line which is now constantly followed by the European Parliament and by the whole of the European Community, to make representations, using the weight of your prestigious office and the institution you represent, to the President and to the Governor of Texas, Mr Bush, who has the power to order a stay of execution and to reprieve the condemned person.

Bush, der zur Aussetzung der Vollstreckung des Todesurteils und zur Begnadigung des Verurteilten befugt ist, geltend zu machen.

Bush, who has the power to stay the execution and grant a pardon to the condemned man.
reference_text: However, I would ask you, in accordance with the line which is now constantly followed by the European Parliament and by the whole of the European Community, to make representations, using the weight of your prestigious office and the institution you represent, to the President and to the Governor of Texas, Mr Bush, who has the power to order a stay of execution and to reprieve the condemned person.

source_text: Wir freuen uns hier alle, daß das Gericht ihn freigesprochen und deutlich gemacht hat, daß auch in Rußland der Zugang zu Umweltinformationen konstitutionelles Recht ist.
translated_text: We are all pleased here that the court has acquitted him and made it clear that access to environmental information is a constitutional right in Russia too.
reference_text: All of us here are pleased that the courts have acquitted him and made it clear that in Russia, too, access to environmental information is a constitutional right.

source_text: Wir freuen uns hier alle, daß das Gericht ihn freigesprochen und deutlich gemacht hat, daß auch in Rußland der Zugang zu Umweltinformationen konstitutionelles Recht ist.

source_text: Nun ist es aber so, daß er wieder angeklagt werden soll, weil der Staatsanwalt in Berufung geht.

source_text: Wir wissen und wir haben es in wirklich sehr vielen Entschließungen festgestellt - gerade während der letzten Plenartagung des vergangenen Jahres-, daß dies nicht nur ein juristischer Fall ist und daß es falsch ist, Alexander Nikitin Kriminalität und Verrat vorzuwerfen, weil wir als Betroffene von seinen Ergebnissen einen Nutzen haben.
translated_text: We know, and we have stated this in a great many resolutions - especially during last year's plenary session - that this is not just a legal case and that it is wrong to accuse Alexander Nikitin of criminality and treason, because we, as those affected, have benefited from his results.
reference_text: We know, and we have stated as much in very many resolutions indeed, including specifically during the last plenary part-session of last year, that this is not solely a legal case and that it is wrong for Alexander Nikitin to be accused of criminal activity and treason because of our involvement as the beneficiaries of his findings.

source_text: Wir wissen und wir haben es in wirklich sehr vielen Entschließungen festgestellt - gerade während der letzten Plenartagung des vergangenen Jahres-, daß dies nicht nur ein juristischer Fall ist und daß es falsch ist, Alexander Nikitin Kriminalität und Verrat vorzuwerfen, weil wir als Betroffene von seinen Ergebnissen einen Nutzen haben.
translated_text: We know, and we have established this in very many resolutions – particularly during the last plenary session of last year – that this is not just a legal case and that it is wrong to accuse Alexander Nikitin of criminality and treason, because we, as those who benefit from his findings, have gained from them.
reference_text: We know, and we have stated as much in very many resolutions indeed, including specifically during the last plenary part-session of last year, that this is not solely a legal case and that it is wrong for Alexander Nikitin to be accused of criminal activity and treason because of our involvement as the beneficiaries of his findings.

translated_text: We know and we have stated it in really very many resolutions - especially during the last plenary session of the past year - that this is not just a legal case and that it is wrong to accuse Alexander Nikitin of criminality and treason because as those affected by his results, we benefit from them.

source_text: Diese Ergebnisse sind die Grundlage für die europäischen Programme zum Schutz der Barentsee, und deswegen bitte ich Sie, einen Briefentwurf, der Ihnen die wichtigsten Fakten schildert, zu prüfen und im Sinne der Beschlüsse des Parlaments in Rußland diese Position deutlich zu machen.
translated_text: These results are the basis for the European programmes for the protection of the Barents Sea, and I therefore ask you to consider a draft letter outlining the most important facts and to make this position clear in the spirit of Parliament's decisions in Russia.
reference_text: These findings form the basis of the European programmes to protect the Barents Sea, and that is why I would ask you to examine a draft letter setting out the most important facts and to make Parliament's position, as expressed in the resolutions which it has adopted, clear as far as Russia is concerned.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, zunächst besten Dank dafür, daß Sie Wort gehalten haben und nun in der ersten Sitzungsperiode des neuen Jahres das Angebot an Fernsehprogrammen in unseren Büros tatsächlich enorm erweitert ist.

source_text: Zwar können wir jetzt zwei finnische und einen portugiesischen, nach wie vor aber keinen niederländischen Sender empfangen. Ich hatte Sie aber um ein niederländisches Programm gebeten, denn auch wir Niederländer möchten die Nachrichten verfolgen, wenn wir jeden Monat hierher in die Verbannung geschickt werden.
translated_text: We can now receive two Finnish and one Portuguese programme, but still no Dutch channel. But I asked you for a Dutch programme, because we Dutch also want to follow the news when we are sent into exile here every month.
reference_text: Although there are now two Finnish channels and one Portuguese one, there is still no Dutch channel, which is what I had requested because Dutch people here like to be able to follow the news too when we are sent to this place of exile every month.

source_text: Deshalb möchte ich Sie nochmals ersuchen, dafür Sorge zu tragen, daß auch ein niederländischer Sender eingespeist wird.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, können Sie mir sagen, warum sich dieses Parlament nicht an die Arbeitsschutzregelungen hält, die es selbst verabschiedet hat?
translated_text: Madam President, can you tell me why this Parliament is not complying with the health and safety rules that it has itself adopted?
reference_text: Madam President, can you tell me why this Parliament does not adhere to the health and safety legislation that it actually passes?

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, können Sie mir sagen, warum sich dieses Parlament nicht an die Arbeitsschutzregelungen hält, die es selbst verabschiedet hat?
translated_text: Madam President, can you tell me why this Parliament is not complying with the occupational safety regulations it itself adopted?
reference_text: Madam President, can you tell me why this Parliament does not adhere to the health and safety legislation that it actually passes?

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, können Sie mir sagen, warum sich dieses Parlament nicht an die Arbeitsschutzregelungen hält, die es selbst verabschiedet hat?
translated_text: Madam President, can you tell me why this parliament does not comply with the occupational safety regulations that it has adopted itself?
reference_text: Madam President, can you tell me why this Parliament does not adhere to the health and safety legislation that it actually passes?

source_text: Weshalb wurde die Luftqualität in diesem Gebäude seit unserer Wahl nicht ein einziges Mal überprüft?
translated_text: Why has the air quality in this building not been checked once since we were elected?
reference_text: Why has no air quality test been done on this particular building since we were elected?

source_text: Weshalb wurde die Luftqualität in diesem Gebäude seit unserer Wahl nicht ein einziges Mal überprüft?
translated_text: Why hasn't the air quality in this building been checked a single time since we moved in?
reference_text: Why has no air quality test been done on this particular building since we were elected?

source_text: Weshalb wurde die Luftqualität in diesem Gebäude seit unserer Wahl nicht ein einziges Mal überprüft?
translated_text: Why has the air quality in this building not been checked even once since our election?
reference_text: Why has no air quality test been done on this particular building since we were elected?

source_text: Weshalb ist der Arbeitsschutzausschuß seit 1998 nicht ein einziges Mal zusammengetreten?
translated_text: Why has the Health and Safety Committee not met once since 1998?
reference_text: Why has there been no Health and Safety Committee meeting since 1998?

source_text: Weshalb ist der Arbeitsschutzausschuß seit 1998 nicht ein einziges Mal zusammengetreten?
translated_text: Why hasn't the occupational safety committee met once since 1998?
reference_text: Why has there been no Health and Safety Committee meeting since 1998?

source_text: Weshalb ist der Arbeitsschutzausschuß seit 1998 nicht ein einziges Mal zusammengetreten?
translated_text: Why has the Occupational Safety Committee not met once since 1998?
reference_text: Why has there been no Health and Safety Committee meeting since 1998?

source_text: Warum hat weder im Brüsseler noch im Straßburger Parlamentsgebäude eine Brandschutzübung stattgefunden?
translated_text: Why was there no fire drill in either the Brussels or Strasbourg parliament buildings?
reference_text: Why has there been no fire drill, either in the Brussels Parliament buildings or the Strasbourg Parliament buildings?

reference_text: Why has there been no fire drill, either in the Brussels Parliament buildings or the Strasbourg Parliament buildings?

reference_text: Why are there no fire instructions?

source_text: Warum finden keine Brandschutzbelehrungen statt?

reference_text: Why are there no fire instructions?

source_text: Warum wurde nach meinem Unfall nichts unternommen, um die Treppen sicherer zu machen?
translated_text: Why was nothing done to make the stairs safer after my accident?
reference_text: Why have the staircases not been improved since my accident?

source_text: Warum wurde nach meinem Unfall nichts unternommen, um die Treppen sicherer zu machen?

source_text: Warum wird in den Nichtraucherzonen das Rauchverbot nicht durchgesetzt?
translated_text: Why is the smoking ban not enforced in non-smoking areas?
reference_text: Why are no-smoking areas not enforced?

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, ich wüßte gern, ob das Parlament in dieser Woche ein deutliches Signal unserer Unzufriedenheit bezüglich der heutigen Entscheidung, mit der eine Verlängerung des Waffenembargos gegen Indonesien abgelehnt wird, aussenden wird, zumal sich die große Mehrheit in diesem Parlament in der Vergangenheit für das Waffenembargo gegen Indonesien ausgesprochen hat.
translated_text: Madam President, I would like to know whether this week Parliament will send out a clear signal of our dissatisfaction with today's decision to reject an extension of the arms embargo on Indonesia, especially as the vast majority in this Parliament have in the past been in favour of the arms embargo on Indonesia.
reference_text: Madam President, I should like to know if there will be a clear message going out from Parliament this week about our discontent over today's decision refusing to renew the arms embargo on Indonesia, considering that the vast majority in this Parliament have endorsed the arms embargo in Indonesia in the past?

reference_text: Today's decision not to renew the embargo is extremely dangerous considering the situation there.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin! Die Vorstellung des politischen Programms der Kommission Prodi für die gesamte Wahlperiode ging auf einen Vorschlag der Fraktion der Sozialdemokratischen Partei Europas zurück, der die einhellige Billigung der Konferenz der Präsidenten im September und auch die ausdrückliche Zustimmung von Präsident Prodi fand, der seine Zusage in seiner Antrittsrede bekräftigte.
translated_text: Madam President, the presentation of the Prodi Commission's political programme for the entire parliamentary term was based on a proposal by the Group of the Party of European Socialists, which received the unanimous approval of the Conference of Presidents in September and also the express agreement of President Prodi, who reaffirmed his commitment in his inaugural speech.
reference_text: Madam President, the presentation of the Prodi Commission' s political programme for the whole legislature was initially a proposal by the Group of the Party of European Socialists which was unanimously approved by the Conference of Presidents in September and which was also explicitly accepted by President Prodi, who reiterated his commitment in his inaugural speech.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin! translated_text: Madam President, the presentation of the Prodi Commission's political programme for the entire parliamentary term was based on a proposal from the Socialist Group in the European Parliament, which received unanimous approval from the Conference of Presidents in September and also the explicit agreement of President Prodi, who reaffirmed his commitment in his inaugural address.

The presentation of the political programme of the Prodi Commission for the entire term of office was based on a proposal by the Group of the Party of European Socialists, which was unanimously approved by the Conference of Presidents in September and also received the explicit agreement of President Prodi, who confirmed his commitment in his opening speech.
reference_text: Madam President, the presentation of the Prodi Commission' s political programme for the whole legislature was initially a proposal by the Group of the Party of European Socialists which was unanimously approved by the Conference of Presidents in September and which was also explicitly accepted by President Prodi, who reiterated his commitment in his inaugural speech.

source_text: Diese Zusage ist insofern von Bedeutung, als die Kommission ein Organ ist, das nach den Verträgen das Initiativmonopol besitzt und somit grundlegend die politische und legislative Tätigkeit dieses Parlaments in den nächsten fünf Jahren gestaltet.
translated_text: This commitment is significant in that the Commission is an institution that has a monopoly on initiative under the Treaties and will therefore fundamentally shape the political and legislative activities of this Parliament over the next five years.
reference_text: This commitment is important because the Commission is a body with a monopoly of initiative in accordance with the Treaties and, therefore, basically dictates this Parliament' s political and legislative activity for the next five years.

source_text: Ich möchte auch daran erinnern, daß dieses Parlament in der vorangegangenen Wahlperiode Präsident Prodi zweimal sein Vertrauen ausgesprochen hat; in dieser Wahlperiode sprach es ihm im Juli erneut sein Vertrauen aus, und dann, als die neue Kommission im Amt war, gab es im September erneut ein Vertrauensvotum für die Kommission insgesamt.
translated_text: I would also like to remind you that, in the previous parliamentary term, this Parliament expressed its confidence in President Prodi twice; in this parliamentary term, it expressed its confidence in him again in July, and then, when the new Commission was in office, there was another vote of confidence in the Commission as a whole in September.
reference_text: I would also like to point out, Madam President, that this Parliament voted to express its confidence in President Prodi during the previous legislature. It did so again during this legislature, in July, and then, in September, it voted once more to approve the whole Commission.

source_text: Somit hatte die Kommission bereits genügend Zeit, ihr Programm zu erarbeiten, und wir, um es kennenlernen und den Bürgern erklären zu können.
translated_text: This means that the Commission has already had enough time to draw up its programme and we have had enough time to get to know it and explain it to the citizens.
reference_text: There has therefore been enough time for the Commission to prepare its programme and for us to become familiar with it and explain it to our citizens.

source_text: Die Ereignisse der vergangenen Woche - die am Rande der Konferenz der Präsidenten ihren Anfang nahmen und wobei diese Konferenz nur zur Bestätigung und Ratifizierung von außerhalb gefaßten Beschlüssen genutzt wurde - verdeutlichen ein Dilemma: Entweder ist die Kommission nicht in der Lage, dieses Programm vorzulegen (In diesem Fall sollte sie eine Klärung herbeiführen.
translated_text: The events of the past week - which began in the margins of the Conference of Presidents and where this conference was used only to confirm and ratify decisions taken outside - illustrate a dilemma: either the Commission is not in a position to present this programme (in which case it should seek clarification) or it is not in a position to do so.
reference_text: The events of last week - which originated outside the Conference of Presidents, that Conference being used simply to corroborate and ratify decisions taken elsewhere - present us with a dilemma. Either the Commission is not ready to present this programme, in which case it should clarify it.

source_text: Da die Kommission durch die Vizepräsidentin, Frau de Palacio, vertreten ist, halte ich es für zweckmäßig, vor der Abstimmung die Position der Kommission hinsichtlich ihrer Bereitschaft zur Vorstellung des Programms, so wie es vereinbart war, zu erfahren.), oder das Parlament ist zur Prüfung dieses Programms nicht in der Lage, wie einige offenbar vorgeben.
translated_text: Since the Commission is represented by the Vice-President, Mrs de Palacio, I think it would be useful to know, before the vote, the Commission's position on its willingness to present the programme as agreed), or Parliament is not in a position to examine this programme, as some seem to claim.
reference_text: Given that the Commission is represented by Vice-President de Palacio, I believe that, before voting, it would help if the Commission could let us know how ready it is to present this programme, as agreed. Alternatively, Parliament is not ready to examine this programme, as some appear to be suggesting.

translated_text: Since the Commission is represented by Vice-President de Palacio, I consider it appropriate to ascertain the Commission's position on its readiness to present the programme as agreed before the vote; otherwise, Parliament will be unable to examine this programme, as some apparently claim.

source_text: Nach meiner Ansicht würde diese zweite Hypothese einem Verzicht auf unsere Verantwortung als Parlament und darüber hinaus dem Aufwerfen einer originellen These, einer unbekannten Methode gleichkommen, die darin bestände, den Fraktionen die programmatische Rede der Kommission in schriftlicher Form eine Woche vorher - und nicht, wie vereinbart, am Tag zuvor - zur Kenntnis zu geben, wobei zu berücksichtigen ist, daß das Legislativprogramm im Februar diskutiert werden wird, so daß wir auf die Aussprache verzichten könnten, da die Presse und das Internet am Tag darauf alle Bürger darüber informiert haben würden und das Parlament keinen Grund mehr hätte, sich mit der Angelegenheit zu befassen.
translated_text: In my view, this second hypothesis would be tantamount to abdicating our responsibilities as a Parliament and, moreover, to putting forward an original thesis, an unknown method, which would be to give the political groups the Commission's programme speech in written form a week beforehand - and not the day before, as agreed, It should be borne in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so that we could dispense with the debate, since the press and the Internet would have informed all the citizens the following day and Parliament would no longer have any reason to deal with the matter.
reference_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would imply the failure of Parliament in its duty as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method which consists of making political groups aware, in writing, of a speech concerning the Commission' s programme a week earlier - and not a day earlier, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so we could forego the debate, since on the next day our citizens will hear about it in the press and on the Internet and Parliament will no longer have to worry about it.

source_text: Nach meiner Ansicht würde diese zweite Hypothese einem Verzicht auf unsere Verantwortung als Parlament und darüber hinaus dem Aufwerfen einer originellen These, einer unbekannten Methode gleichkommen, die darin bestände, den Fraktionen die programmatische Rede der Kommission in schriftlicher Form eine Woche vorher - und nicht, wie vereinbart, am Tag zuvor - zur Kenntnis zu geben, wobei zu berücksichtigen ist, daß das Legislativprogramm im Februar diskutiert werden wird, so daß wir auf die Aussprache verzichten könnten, da die Presse und das Internet am Tag darauf alle Bürger darüber informiert haben würden und das Parlament keinen Grund mehr hätte, sich mit der Angelegenheit zu befassen.
translated_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would amount to an abdication of our responsibility as Parliament and, moreover, to proposing an original, unprecedented method: giving the factions the Commission's programmatic speech in writing a week in advance – instead of the day before, as agreed.  This is especially considering that the legislative program will be discussed in February, meaning we could forgo the debate, as the press and internet would inform all citizens the following day, rendering any further parliamentary involvement unnecessary.
reference_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would imply the failure of Parliament in its duty as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method which consists of making political groups aware, in writing, of a speech concerning the Commission' s programme a week earlier - and not a day earlier, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so we could forego the debate, since on the next day our citizens will hear about it in the press and on the Internet and Parliament will no longer have to worry about it.

translated_text: In my view, this second hypothesis would amount to a relinquishment of our responsibility as Parliament and, furthermore, to putting forward an original thesis, an unknown method, which would consist of bringing to the attention of the groups, in written form, one week in advance - and not, as agreed, the day before - the Commission's programme speech, taking into account that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so that we could dispense with the debate, since the press and the internet would have informed all citizens about it the next day and Parliament would no longer have any reason to deal with the matter.
reference_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would imply the failure of Parliament in its duty as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method which consists of making political groups aware, in writing, of a speech concerning the Commission' s programme a week earlier - and not a day earlier, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so we could forego the debate, since on the next day our citizens will hear about it in the press and on the Internet and Parliament will no longer have to worry about it.

source_text: Da meine Fraktion der Meinung ist, daß ein Parlament dazu da ist, zuzuhören, zu diskutieren und nachzudenken, gibt es unserer Ansicht nach keinen Grund zur Rechtfertigung dieser Verzögerung, und wir glauben, wenn die Kommission dazu in der Lage ist, liegen wir genau in der Zeit, um die ursprüngliche Vereinbarung zwischen dem Parlament und der Kommission wieder in Kraft zu setzen und verantwortungsbewußt vor unsere Mitbürgerinnen und Mitbürgern treten zu können.
translated_text: As my group believes that a Parliament is there to listen, discuss and reflect, we believe that there is no reason to justify this delay and we believe that if the Commission is able to do so, we are right on time to reinstate the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and to be able to come before our fellow citizens responsibly.
reference_text: My Group believes that since a parliament is meant to listen, debate and reflect, there can be no justification whatsoever for this delay and we believe that, if the Commission is ready to do so, we still have time to re-establish the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and proceed in a manner which fulfils our duty to our fellow citizens.

translated_text: Since our parliamentary group believes that a parliament is there to listen, discuss, and reflect, we see no reason to justify this delay.  We believe that if the Commission is able to do so, we are precisely on schedule to reinstate the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and to act responsibly towards our fellow citizens.

source_text: Deshalb besteht der Vorschlag der Fraktion der Sozialdemokratischen Partei Europas, den Sie erwähnt haben, darin, den Mittwoch als Termin der Vorstellung des Programms der Kommission Prodi für die Wahlperiode beizubehalten, und in dieses Programm auch das Verwaltungsreformprojekt einzubeziehen, da wir andernfalls in eine paradoxe Situation geraten könnten: Mit der Ausrede, der Wortlaut liege nicht vor, wird einerseits dem Präsidenten der Kommission das Recht abgesprochen, in diesem Parlament zu sprechen, und andererseits würde eine Aussprache über die Reform stattfinden, ohne daß dieses Parlament zuvor die Texte lesen konnte, die der Aussprache zugrunde liegen.
translated_text: That is why the proposal of the Group of the Party of European Socialists, which you mentioned, is to keep Wednesday as the date for the presentation of the Prodi Commission's programme for the parliamentary term, and to include the administrative reform project in this programme, because otherwise we could end up in a paradoxical situation: On the one hand, the excuse that the text is not available would deny the President of the Commission the right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other hand, a debate on the reform would take place without this Parliament having first been able to read the texts on which the debate is based.
reference_text: Therefore, the proposal of the Group of the Party of European Socialists, and which you have mentioned, is that the Prodi Commission present its legislative programme on Wednesday, including its proposed administrative reform, because, otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: on the pretext that there is no text, on the one hand, the President of the Commission would be denied his right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other hand, there would be a debate on a reform when Parliament had no prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.

source_text: Deshalb besteht der Vorschlag der Fraktion der Sozialdemokratischen Partei Europas, den Sie erwähnt haben, darin, den Mittwoch als Termin der Vorstellung des Programms der Kommission Prodi für die Wahlperiode beizubehalten, und in dieses Programm auch das Verwaltungsreformprojekt einzubeziehen, da wir andernfalls in eine paradoxe Situation geraten könnten: Mit der Ausrede, der Wortlaut liege nicht vor, wird einerseits dem Präsidenten der Kommission das Recht abgesprochen, in diesem Parlament zu sprechen, und andererseits würde eine Aussprache über die Reform stattfinden, ohne daß dieses Parlament zuvor die Texte lesen konnte, die der Aussprache zugrunde liegen.
translated_text: Therefore, the proposal from the Group of the Party of European Socialists, which you mentioned, is to retain Wednesday as the date for the presentation of the Prodi Commission's programme for the parliamentary term, and to include the administrative reform project in this programme. Otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: under the pretext that the text is not available, the President of the Commission would be denied the right to speak in this Parliament, and a debate on the reform would take place without this Parliament having first been able to read the texts forming the basis of the debate.
reference_text: Therefore, the proposal of the Group of the Party of European Socialists, and which you have mentioned, is that the Prodi Commission present its legislative programme on Wednesday, including its proposed administrative reform, because, otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: on the pretext that there is no text, on the one hand, the President of the Commission would be denied his right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other hand, there would be a debate on a reform when Parliament had no prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.

source_text: Daher bitte ich Sie, Frau Präsidentin, die Kommission zu ersuchen, sich jetzt zu äußern, und danach zur Abstimmung zu schreiten.
translated_text: I would therefore ask you, Madam President, to ask the Commission to speak now and then proceed to the vote.
reference_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would ask you to request that the Commission express its opinion on this issue and that we then proceed to the vote.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, liebe Kolleginnen und Kollegen! Ich bin doch etwas erstaunt über das Verhalten des Kollegen Barón Crespo, der jetzt verlangt, daß dieser Tagesordnungspunkt auf die Tagesordnung für Mittwoch gesetzt wird.
translated_text: Madam President, ladies and gentlemen, I am somewhat surprised at the behaviour of Mr Barón Crespo. I am somewhat astonished at the behaviour of Mr Barón Crespo, who is now demanding that this item be placed on the agenda for Wednesday.
reference_text: Madam President, I really am quite astonished at Mr Barón Crespo' s behaviour and the fact that he is now asking for this item to be put on Wednesday's agenda.

source_text: Wir haben Vertrauen zur Kommission, zu Romano Prodi, und die ganz große Mehrheit unserer Fraktion hat Romano Prodi und der Kommission nach einem schwierigen Prozeß, wie jeder weiß, das Vertrauen ausgesprochen.

source_text: Aber wir sind auch der Meinung, daß wir eine Debatte über diese Strategie der Kommission in einem geordneten Verfahren führen müssen, nicht nur aufgrund einer mündlichen Erklärung hier im Europäischen Parlament, sondern auch aufgrund eines Dokumentes, das in der Kommission beschlossen ist und dieses Programm für fünf Jahre beschreibt.
translated_text: But we are also of the opinion that we must hold a debate on this Commission strategy in an orderly procedure, not only on the basis of an oral statement here in the European Parliament, but also on the basis of a document which has been adopted in the Commission and which describes this programme for five years.
reference_text: We believe, however, that the Commission's strategic plan needs to be debated within a proper procedural framework, not only on the basis of an oral statement here in the European Parliament, but also on the basis of a document which is adopted in the Commission and which describes this programme over the five-year period.

source_text: Wir wollen ja an sich keinen Streit mit der Kommission, sondern wir sind der Meinung, wenn es eben geht, müssen Kommission und Parlament einen gemeinsamen Weg gehen.
translated_text: We do not actually want a dispute with the Commission, but we are of the opinion that, if at all possible, the Commission and Parliament must take a common path.
reference_text: After all, we do not wish to quarrel with the Commission; if at all possible, we believe that the Commission and Parliament need to tread the same path.

source_text: Wir wollen ja an sich keinen Streit mit der Kommission, sondern wir sind der Meinung, wenn es eben geht, müssen Kommission und Parlament einen gemeinsamen Weg gehen.

source_text: Aber wir als Parlament sind auch der Kontrolleur der Kommission. Und nicht alles, was von der Kommission kommt, muß unsere Meinung sein.
translated_text: But we in Parliament are also the Commission's watchdog. And not everything that comes from the Commission has to be our opinion.
reference_text: However, we in Parliament also have a supervisory role with regard to the Commission and we do not have to agree with everything which comes out of the Commission.

source_text: Aber wir als Parlament sind auch der Kontrolleur der Kommission. Und nicht alles, was von der Kommission kommt, muß unsere Meinung sein.

source_text: Ich möchte, daß wir uns auf eine Debatte über das Fünfjahresprogramm in den Fraktionen vernünftig vorbereiten können.
translated_text: I would like us to be able to prepare ourselves properly for a debate on the five-year programme in the parliamentary groups.
reference_text: I should like us to be able to do a reasonable amount of preparation for the debate on the five-year programme in our Groups.

source_text: Ich möchte, daß wir uns auf eine Debatte über das Fünfjahresprogramm in den Fraktionen vernünftig vorbereiten können.

translated_text: I would like us to be able to prepare for a debate on the five-year programme in the groups in a sensible way.
reference_text: I should like us to be able to do a reasonable amount of preparation for the debate on the five-year programme in our Groups.

source_text: Man kann sich nicht vorbereiten, wenn man hier eine Erklärung hört und gar nicht weiß, was Inhalt einer solchen Erklärung ist.
translated_text: You can't prepare yourself when you hear an explanation here and don't even know what the content of such an explanation is.
reference_text: You cannot prepare if you hear a statement in this House and have no idea of its content.

source_text: Deswegen ist es unsere Empfehlung - und mein Eindruck ist, daß die Kommission auch aufgeschlossen ist für diesen Gedanken -, daß wir im Februar die Debatte über das langfristige Programm der Kommission bis zum Jahre 2005 führen - ich hoffe, die Kommission wird sich bis dahin auch auf ein Programm verständigen, das sie uns vorschlagen wird -, und daß wir gleichzeitig im Februar auch die Debatte über das Legislativprogramm der Kommission für das Jahr 2000 führen.
translated_text: That is why we recommend - and my impression is that the Commission is also open to this idea - that we hold the debate in February on the Commission's long-term programme up to the year 2005 - I hope that the Commission will also agree on a programme by then, which it will propose to us - and that we also hold the debate in February on the Commission's legislative programme for the year 2000.
reference_text: That is why we would recommend - and it is my impression that the Commission is also open to this idea - that we hold the debate on the Commission's long-term programme up to the year 2005 in February - and I hope that the Commission will agree on a programme before then which it will propose to us - and that, at the same time, in February we also hold the debate on the Commission's legislative programme for the year 2000.

source_text: Deswegen ist es unsere Empfehlung - und mein Eindruck ist, daß die Kommission auch aufgeschlossen ist für diesen Gedanken -, daß wir im Februar die Debatte über das langfristige Programm der Kommission bis zum Jahre 2005 führen - ich hoffe, die Kommission wird sich bis dahin auch auf ein Programm verständigen, das sie uns vorschlagen wird -, und daß wir gleichzeitig im Februar auch die Debatte über das Legislativprogramm der Kommission für das Jahr 2000 führen.
translated_text: Therefore, our recommendation – and my impression is that the Commission is also open to this idea – is that we hold the debate on the Commission's long-term programme until 2005 in February.  I hope the Commission will have agreed on a programme by then, which it will propose to us.  At the same time, in February we should also hold the debate on the Commission's legislative programme for the year 2000.
reference_text: That is why we would recommend - and it is my impression that the Commission is also open to this idea - that we hold the debate on the Commission's long-term programme up to the year 2005 in February - and I hope that the Commission will agree on a programme before then which it will propose to us - and that, at the same time, in February we also hold the debate on the Commission's legislative programme for the year 2000.

source_text: Es ist also auch ein vernünftiger sachlicher Zusammenhang, der uns rät, die Debatte über beide Programme gemeinsam zu führen.
translated_text: It is therefore also a sensible factual context that advises us to conduct the debate on both programmes together.
reference_text: The fact that the subjects are connected also suggests that we should hold the debate on both programmes together.

reference_text: The fact that the subjects are connected also suggests that we should hold the debate on both programmes together.

reference_text: The fact that the subjects are connected also suggests that we should hold the debate on both programmes together.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, da ich bei den Sozialisten ein bißchen Gelächter höre - mir wurde gesagt, daß auch weite Kreise der Sozialistischen Fraktion diesen Tagesordnungspunkt gern abgesetzt haben wollen, weil bei der Abstimmung in der Konferenz der Präsidenten das Votum der Arbeitsgruppe der zuständigen Kolleginnen und Kollegen der Sozialistischen Fraktion nicht vorlag.
translated_text: Madam President, since I hear a little laughter from the Socialists, I have been told that large sections of the Socialist Group would also like to have this item removed from the agenda because the vote in the Conference of Presidents did not include the vote of the working party of the relevant Socialist Group colleagues.
reference_text: Madam President, I can hear a ripple of laughter from the Socialists. I was told that large sections of the Socialist Group were also keen to have this item taken off the agenda, because at the vote in the Conference of Presidents no vote was received from the working group of Members of the Socialist Group responsible for this matter.

source_text: Zum einen belehrt er die Sozialdemokratische Fraktion, weil diese eine ganz klare und eindeutige Entscheidung der Konferenz der Präsidenten in Frage stellt. Und nun tut er genau dasselbe.
translated_text: On the one hand, he is lecturing the Socialist Group because they are questioning a very clear and unambiguous decision by the Conference of Presidents. And now he is doing exactly the same.
reference_text: He has just been preaching to the Group of the Party of European Socialists because they went back on a decision taken in a perfectly clear manner at the Conference of Presidents, and now he is doing just the same.

source_text: Zum einen belehrt er die Sozialdemokratische Fraktion, weil diese eine ganz klare und eindeutige Entscheidung der Konferenz der Präsidenten in Frage stellt. Und nun tut er genau dasselbe.

source_text: Wir haben diskutiert, wir waren uns einig, nur die EVP-Fraktion und die Liberalen nicht.
translated_text: We discussed it, we were in agreement, only the EPP Group and the Liberals were not.
reference_text: We discussed that matter and we were unanimous, with the exception of the PPE and ELDR Groups.

translated_text: We discussed it, we reached an agreement, except for the EPP Group and the Liberals.

source_text: Wir haben diskutiert, wir waren uns einig, nur die EVP-Fraktion und die Liberalen nicht.

reference_text: We discussed that matter and we were unanimous, with the exception of the PPE and ELDR Groups.

source_text: Und ich hatte noch darauf hingewiesen, die anderen Präsidentenkollegen werden sich noch daran erinnern, daß es nicht darum geht, ob man für oder gegen die Tobin-Steuer ist, sondern darum, ob wir bereit sind, uns anzuhören, was die Kommission und der Rat davon halten.
translated_text: And I also pointed out, as the other presidential colleagues will remember, that it is not a question of whether we are in favour of or against the Tobin tax, but whether we are prepared to listen to what the Commission and the Council think about it.
reference_text: As my fellow chairmen will recall, I even mentioned that it was not a matter of knowing whether one was for or against the Tobin tax, but of whether one dared to hear what the Commission and the Council thought of it.

source_text: Und ich hatte noch darauf hingewiesen, die anderen Präsidentenkollegen werden sich noch daran erinnern, daß es nicht darum geht, ob man für oder gegen die Tobin-Steuer ist, sondern darum, ob wir bereit sind, uns anzuhören, was die Kommission und der Rat davon halten.
translated_text: And I had pointed out – my fellow presidents will remember this – that the issue is not whether one is for or against the Tobin tax, but whether we are prepared to listen to what the Commission and the Council think of it.
reference_text: As my fellow chairmen will recall, I even mentioned that it was not a matter of knowing whether one was for or against the Tobin tax, but of whether one dared to hear what the Commission and the Council thought of it.

source_text: Und ich hatte noch darauf hingewiesen, die anderen Präsidentenkollegen werden sich noch daran erinnern, daß es nicht darum geht, ob man für oder gegen die Tobin-Steuer ist, sondern darum, ob wir bereit sind, uns anzuhören, was die Kommission und der Rat davon halten.
translated_text: And I had also pointed out that the other President colleagues will still recall that it is not about being for or against the Tobin tax, but about whether we are willing to listen to what the Commission and the Council think about it.
reference_text: As my fellow chairmen will recall, I even mentioned that it was not a matter of knowing whether one was for or against the Tobin tax, but of whether one dared to hear what the Commission and the Council thought of it.

source_text: Das ist nicht zuviel verlangt.
translated_text: That is not too much to ask.
reference_text: It is not a lot to ask.

source_text: Das ist nicht zuviel verlangt.

source_text: Ich wiederhole also den Vorschlag, diese mündliche Anfrage an die Kommission und den Rat aufrechtzuerhalten, um ein für alle Mal die Meinung dieser beiden Institutionen zu diesem relativ bescheidenen Vorschlag zu erfahren, der für die Öffentlichkeit ein wichtiges Signal wäre, insbesondere nach der Aufregung im Gefolge des Scheiterns der Konferenz von Seattle.
translated_text: I therefore repeat the proposal to maintain this oral question to the Commission and the Council in order to know once and for all the opinion of these two institutions on this relatively modest proposal, which would be an important signal to the public, especially after the furore following the failure of the Seattle conference.
reference_text: I therefore repeat the proposal that this oral question to the Commission and the Council should be retained so that we can find out, once and for all, the positions of these two bodies regarding the proposal which is relatively modest but which would give a clear message to public opinion, particularly after the tide of feeling generated by the failure of the Seattle Conference.

source_text: Ich wiederhole also den Vorschlag, diese mündliche Anfrage an die Kommission und den Rat aufrechtzuerhalten, um ein für alle Mal die Meinung dieser beiden Institutionen zu diesem relativ bescheidenen Vorschlag zu erfahren, der für die Öffentlichkeit ein wichtiges Signal wäre, insbesondere nach der Aufregung im Gefolge des Scheiterns der Konferenz von Seattle.
translated_text: Therefore, I reiterate the proposal to maintain this oral question to the Commission and the Council in order to finally obtain the opinion of these two institutions on this relatively modest proposal, which would send an important signal to the public, particularly after the turmoil following the failure of the Seattle conference.
reference_text: I therefore repeat the proposal that this oral question to the Commission and the Council should be retained so that we can find out, once and for all, the positions of these two bodies regarding the proposal which is relatively modest but which would give a clear message to public opinion, particularly after the tide of feeling generated by the failure of the Seattle Conference.

source_text: Ich wiederhole also den Vorschlag, diese mündliche Anfrage an die Kommission und den Rat aufrechtzuerhalten, um ein für alle Mal die Meinung dieser beiden Institutionen zu diesem relativ bescheidenen Vorschlag zu erfahren, der für die Öffentlichkeit ein wichtiges Signal wäre, insbesondere nach der Aufregung im Gefolge des Scheiterns der Konferenz von Seattle.
translated_text: I am therefore reiterating the proposal to maintain this oral question to the Commission and the Council, in order to once and for all obtain the opinion of these two institutions on this relatively modest proposal, which would be an important signal to the public, especially after the upset following the failure of the Seattle conference.
reference_text: I therefore repeat the proposal that this oral question to the Commission and the Council should be retained so that we can find out, once and for all, the positions of these two bodies regarding the proposal which is relatively modest but which would give a clear message to public opinion, particularly after the tide of feeling generated by the failure of the Seattle Conference.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, bei der früheren Abstimmung zur Frage des Strategieplans der Kommission - keine Angst, ich werde mich an Ihre Entscheidung in dieser Sache halten - hatte ich darum gebeten, vor der Abstimmung im Namen meiner Fraktion sprechen zu dürfen.
translated_text: Madam President, in the earlier vote on the question of the Commission's strategic plan - do not worry, I will abide by your decision on this matter - I had asked to speak on behalf of my group before the vote.
reference_text: Madam President, in the earlier vote - and I will abide by your ruling on this matter - on the question of the strategic plan of the Commission I indicated that I would like to speak in advance of the vote on behalf of my Group.

source_text: Vielleicht wäre es sinnvoll festzuhalten, wie das, was wir eben getan haben, von den einzelnen vor dem Hintergrund ihrer eigenen politischen Analyse aufgenommen wird.

source_text: Wenn wir morgen das Protokoll der Sitzung von heute verabschieden, können die Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die der Auffassung sind, daß die Positionen nicht ausreichend klar geworden sind, Änderungen beantragen.
translated_text: When we adopt the minutes of today's meeting tomorrow, colleagues who believe that the positions have not been sufficiently clarified can request amendments.
reference_text: When we adopt the Minutes for today' s sitting tomorrow, then any Members who think the positions have not been explained clearly enough may ask for amendments.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, wenn aus der Abstimmung einwandfrei hervorgeht, wie meine Fraktion abgestimmt hat, dann werde und kann ich nichts dagegen sagen.
translated_text: Madam President, if the vote clearly shows how my group voted, then I will not and cannot say anything against it.
reference_text: Madam President, if the vote records correctly how my Group voted I shall not, and cannot, object to that.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, wenn aus der Abstimmung einwandfrei hervorgeht, wie meine Fraktion abgestimmt hat, dann werde und kann ich nichts dagegen sagen.
translated_text: Madam President, if the vote clearly shows how my group voted, then I have no objection.
reference_text: Madam President, if the vote records correctly how my Group voted I shall not, and cannot, object to that.

source_text: Frau Präsidentin, wenn aus der Abstimmung einwandfrei hervorgeht, wie meine Fraktion abgestimmt hat, dann werde und kann ich nichts dagegen sagen.
translated_text: Madam President, if the voting results clearly show how my group voted, then I will say nothing and can say nothing against it.
reference_text: Madam President, if the vote records correctly how my Group voted I shall not, and cannot, object to that.

source_text: Wenn Sie festlegen, daß ich keine Erklärung zur Abstimmung abgeben kann, akzeptiere ich das, wenngleich unter Vorbehalt.
translated_text: If you stipulate that I cannot give an explanation of vote, I accept that, albeit with reservations.
reference_text: If your ruling is that I cannot give an explanation of vote, I accept that but with reservations.

source_text: Wenn Sie festlegen, daß ich keine Erklärung zur Abstimmung abgeben kann, akzeptiere ich das, wenngleich unter Vorbehalt.
translated_text: If you determine that I cannot give an explanation of the vote, I accept that, albeit under protest.
reference_text: If your ruling is that I cannot give an explanation of vote, I accept that but with reservations.

source_text: Wenn Sie festlegen, daß ich keine Erklärung zur Abstimmung abgeben kann, akzeptiere ich das, wenngleich unter Vorbehalt.
translated_text: If you decide that I am not allowed to give an explanation for my vote, I accept that, albeit with reservations.
reference_text: If your ruling is that I cannot give an explanation of vote, I accept that but with reservations.

source_text: Beim Abfassen des Protokolls werden wir mit großer Sorgfalt vorgehen. Das tun wir im übrigen immer.
translated_text: We will take great care when drafting the minutes. We always do that, by the way.
reference_text: We shall pay particular attention to the wording of the Minutes, as we always do, of course.

source_text: Beim Abfassen des Protokolls werden wir mit großer Sorgfalt vorgehen. Das tun wir im übrigen immer.
translated_text: We will proceed with great care in drafting the minutes.  We always do, incidentally.
reference_text: We shall pay particular attention to the wording of the Minutes, as we always do, of course.

source_text: Beim Abfassen des Protokolls werden wir mit großer Sorgfalt vorgehen. Das tun wir im übrigen immer.
translated_text: When drawing up the minutes, we will proceed with great care, which we always do anyway.
reference_text: We shall pay particular attention to the wording of the Minutes, as we always do, of course.

source_text: Wenn Positionen nicht richtig wiedergegeben werden, können wir das Protokoll gegebenenfalls ändern.
translated_text: If items are not reproduced correctly, we can amend the protocol if necessary.
reference_text: If they do not properly reflect the positions adopted, then we may correct them, if necessary.

source_text: Wenn Positionen nicht richtig wiedergegeben werden, können wir das Protokoll gegebenenfalls ändern.
translated_text: If positions are not correctly represented, we can change the protocol accordingly.
reference_text: If they do not properly reflect the positions adopted, then we may correct them, if necessary.

source_text: Wenn Positionen nicht richtig wiedergegeben werden, können wir das Protokoll gegebenenfalls ändern.
