reference_text: Die Verkehrssicherheit bestimmte in letzter Zeit häufig die Negativschlagzeilen: Das Eisenbahnunglück nahe dem Londoner Bahnhof Paddington, das furchtbare Eisenbahnunglück in Norwegen, zwei Flugzeugabstürze, bei denen EU-Bürger zu Schaden kamen, und die von der Erika vor der bretonischen Küste verursachte Naturkatastrophe sind Ereignisse, die allein in den letzten vier Monaten zu verzeichnen waren. Sie machen deutlich, daß Verkehrssicherheit keine Selbstverständlichkeit ist und daß diejenigen, die für den Schutz der Öffentlichkeit verantwortlich sind, hochmotiviert und hochqualifiziert sein müssen.

source_text: Transport safety has sadly been in the news recently: the Paddington rail crash in London, the terrible rail crash in Norway, the two aviation crashes involving EU citizens and the natural disaster involving the Erika off Brittany - all within the last four months - remind us that transport safety can never be taken for granted and that those charged with protecting the public must be highly motivated and highly qualified.
translated_text: Die Verkehrssicherheit stand leider kürzlich in den Nachrichten: der Zugunglück in Paddington in London, das schreckliche Zugunglück in Norwegen, die beiden Flugzeugabstürze, an denen EU-Bürger beteiligt waren, und die Naturkatastrophe mit der Erika vor der bretonischen Küste - all dies innerhalb der letzten vier Monate - erinnern uns daran, dass die Verkehrssicherheit niemals als selbstverständlich angesehen werden kann und dass diejenigen, die mit dem Schutz der Öffentlichkeit betraut sind, hoch motiviert und hoch qualifiziert sein müssen.
reference_text: Die Verkehrssicherheit bestimmte in letzter Zeit häufig die Negativschlagzeilen: Das Eisenbahnunglück nahe dem Londoner Bahnhof Paddington, das furchtbare Eisenbahnunglück in Norwegen, zwei Flugzeugabstürze, bei denen EU-Bürger zu Schaden kamen, und die von der Erika vor der bretonischen Küste verursachte Naturkatastrophe sind Ereignisse, die allein in den letzten vier Monaten zu verzeichnen waren. Sie machen deutlich, daß Verkehrssicherheit keine Selbstverständlichkeit ist und daß diejenigen, die für den Schutz der Öffentlichkeit verantwortlich sind, hochmotiviert und hochqualifiziert sein müssen.

source_text: The rapporteur has pointed out to the House that in its common position the Council has accepted six of Parliament's ten amendments put forward at first reading and that the substance of Parliament's other amendments has been retained.
translated_text: Der Berichterstatter hat das Haus darauf hingewiesen, dass der Rat in seinem Gemeinsamen Standpunkt sechs der zehn vom Parlament in erster Lesung vorgeschlagenen Abänderungen akzeptiert hat und dass die übrigen Abänderungen des Parlaments im Wesentlichen übernommen wurden.
reference_text: Der Berichterstatter stellte fest, daß der Rat in seinem Gemeinsamen Standpunkt sechs der zehn vom Parlament in der ersten Lesung angenommenen Änderungen übernommen hat und daß die übrigen Änderungen des Parlaments im wesentlichen berücksichtigt worden sind.

source_text: The rapporteur has pointed out to the House that in its common position the Council has accepted six of Parliament's ten amendments put forward at first reading and that the substance of Parliament's other amendments has been retained.
translated_text: Der Berichterstatter hat dem Haus mitgeteilt, dass der Rat in seinem Gemeinsamen Standpunkt sechs der zehn vom Parlament in erster Lesung vorgelegten Änderungsanträge angenommen hat und der Inhalt der übrigen Änderungsanträge des Parlaments beibehalten wurde.
reference_text: Der Berichterstatter stellte fest, daß der Rat in seinem Gemeinsamen Standpunkt sechs der zehn vom Parlament in der ersten Lesung angenommenen Änderungen übernommen hat und daß die übrigen Änderungen des Parlaments im wesentlichen berücksichtigt worden sind.

source_text: The rapporteur has pointed out to the House that in its common position the Council has accepted six of Parliament's ten amendments put forward at first reading and that the substance of Parliament's other amendments has been retained.
translated_text: Der Berichterstatter hat dem Haus mitgeteilt, dass der Rat in seinem Gemeinsamen Standpunkt sechs der zehn Änderungsanträge des Parlaments, die in erster Lesung vorgelegt wurden, angenommen hat und dass der Inhalt der anderen Änderungsanträge des Parlaments beibehalten wurde.
reference_text: Der Berichterstatter stellte fest, daß der Rat in seinem Gemeinsamen Standpunkt sechs der zehn vom Parlament in der ersten Lesung angenommenen Änderungen übernommen hat und daß die übrigen Änderungen des Parlaments im wesentlichen berücksichtigt worden sind.

source_text: My Group will therefore support the common position and looks forward to the enactment of the legislation which will provide us with yet another tool in our fight to make transport in the European Union as safe as possible.
translated_text: Meine Fraktion wird daher den Gemeinsamen Standpunkt unterstützen und sieht der Verabschiedung der Rechtsvorschrift erwartungsvoll entgegen, die uns ein weiteres Instrument in unserem Kampf für die größtmögliche Sicherheit des Verkehrs in der Europäischen Union an die Hand geben wird.
reference_text: Meine Fraktion wird den Gemeinsamen Standpunkt daher unterstützen und begrüßt die baldige Umsetzung der Regelung, die ein weiteres Instrument im Kampf um die maximale Erhöhung der Verkehrssicherheit in der EU darstellen wird.

source_text: My Group will therefore support the common position and looks forward to the enactment of the legislation which will provide us with yet another tool in our fight to make transport in the European Union as safe as possible.
translated_text: Meine Gruppe wird daher die gemeinsame Position unterstützen und erwartet die Verabschiedung des Rechtsakts, der uns ein weiteres Instrument in unserem Kampf für einen möglichst sicheren Verkehr in der Europäischen Union liefern wird.
reference_text: Meine Fraktion wird den Gemeinsamen Standpunkt daher unterstützen und begrüßt die baldige Umsetzung der Regelung, die ein weiteres Instrument im Kampf um die maximale Erhöhung der Verkehrssicherheit in der EU darstellen wird.

source_text: My Group will therefore support the common position and looks forward to the enactment of the legislation which will provide us with yet another tool in our fight to make transport in the European Union as safe as possible.
translated_text: Meine Gruppe wird daher der gemeinsamen Position zustimmen und freut sich auf die Verabschiedung der Gesetzgebung, die uns ein weiteres Instrument im Kampf für sichere Verkehrsmittel in der Europäischen Union an die Hand gibt, um den Verkehr in der Europäischen Union so sicher wie möglich zu machen.
reference_text: Meine Fraktion wird den Gemeinsamen Standpunkt daher unterstützen und begrüßt die baldige Umsetzung der Regelung, die ein weiteres Instrument im Kampf um die maximale Erhöhung der Verkehrssicherheit in der EU darstellen wird.

source_text: When it comes to safety my Group will always support any initiatives to improve transport safety.
translated_text: Was die Sicherheit betrifft, so wird meine Fraktion stets alle Initiativen zur Verbesserung der Verkehrssicherheit unterstützen.
reference_text: Initiativen zur Erhöhung der Verkehrssicherheit werden jederzeit von meiner Fraktion unterstützt.

source_text: When it comes to safety my Group will always support any initiatives to improve transport safety.

source_text: Needless to say, safety on roads, railways and inland waterways is of key importance and, given the international nature of these types of transport, training for safety advisors should also be harmonised, therefore, as well as the requirements of the new ADR, for example, which is under way.
translated_text: Es versteht sich von selbst, dass die Sicherheit im Straßen-, Eisenbahn- und Binnenschiffsverkehr von zentraler Bedeutung ist, und angesichts des internationalen Charakters dieser Verkehrsarten sollte auch die Ausbildung der Sicherheitsberater harmonisiert werden, ebenso wie beispielsweise die Anforderungen des neuen ADR, das derzeit erarbeitet wird.
reference_text: Selbstverständlich kommt der Verkehrssicherheit auf Straße, Schiene oder Binnenwasserstraßen überaus große Bedeutung zu, und angesichts des internationalen Charakters dieser Transporte ist es erforderlich, die Ausbildungsgänge für Sicherheitsberater sowie die Anforderungen beispielsweise im kommenden neuen ADR zu harmonisieren.

source_text: Needless to say, safety on roads, railways and inland waterways is of key importance and, given the international nature of these types of transport, training for safety advisors should also be harmonised, therefore, as well as the requirements of the new ADR, for example, which is under way.
translated_text: Selbstverständlich ist die Sicherheit auf Straßen, Schienen und Binnenwasserstraßen von größter Bedeutung, und angesichts des internationalen Charakters dieser Verkehrsträger sollte auch die Ausbildung von Sicherheitsberatern harmonisiert werden, beispielsweise auch im Hinblick auf die Anforderungen des neuen ADR, das sich in der Entwicklung befindet.
reference_text: Selbstverständlich kommt der Verkehrssicherheit auf Straße, Schiene oder Binnenwasserstraßen überaus große Bedeutung zu, und angesichts des internationalen Charakters dieser Transporte ist es erforderlich, die Ausbildungsgänge für Sicherheitsberater sowie die Anforderungen beispielsweise im kommenden neuen ADR zu harmonisieren.

source_text: This is important, but so is enforcement and there are, of course, a number of reasons why we need to pay particular attention to this.

reference_text: Das halte ich ebenso wie die Umsetzung für wichtig. Natürlich gibt es gute Gründe, weshalb wir diesem Problem besondere Aufmerksamkeit widmen müssen.

source_text: Just think of the road accidents which have occurred over recent years, for example in Belgium, the Netherlands and a number of other countries where lorries carrying dangerous goods continued to drive in foggy conditions when really they should have pulled off the road instead.
translated_text: Man denke nur an die Verkehrsunfälle, die sich in den letzten Jahren ereignet haben, z. B. in Belgien, den Niederlanden und einer Reihe anderer Länder, wo Lastwagen mit gefährlichen Gütern bei Nebel weiterfuhren, obwohl sie eigentlich von der Straße hätten abfahren müssen.
reference_text: Denken Sie an die Unfälle, die sich in den letzten Jahren im Straßenverkehr ereignet haben. Beispielsweise in Belgien, den Niederlanden und weiteren Ländern fuhren Gefahrguttransporter trotz Nebels weiter und wurden nicht, wie es angesichts der Umstände eigentlich erforderlich gewesen wäre, am Straßenrand abgestellt.

source_text: Declaro reanudado el período de sesiones del Parlamento Europeo, interrumpido el viernes 17 de diciembre pasado, y reitero a Sus Señorías mi deseo de que hayan tenido unas buenas vacaciones.
translated_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December and I wish you a pleasant holiday.
reference_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.

source_text: Declaro reanudado el período de sesiones del Parlamento Europeo, interrumpido el viernes 17 de diciembre pasado, y reitero a Sus Señorías mi deseo de que hayan tenido unas buenas vacaciones.
translated_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament, adjourned last Friday, 17 December, and I reiterate to you, Honourable Members, my wish that you have had a pleasant holiday.
reference_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.

source_text: Declaro reanudado el período de sesiones del Parlamento Europeo, interrumpido el viernes 17 de diciembre pasado, y reitero a Sus Señorías mi deseo de que hayan tenido unas buenas vacaciones.
translated_text: I declare the session of the European Parliament resumed, which was interrupted on Friday, 17 December last, and I reiterate to Your Lordships my wish that you had a good holiday.
reference_text: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.

source_text: Como todos han podido comprobar, el gran "efecto del año 2000" no se ha producido. En cambio, los ciudadanos de varios de nuestros países han sido víctimas de catástrofes naturales verdaderamente terribles.
translated_text: As you have all seen, the great "Y2K bug" has not happened. Instead, the citizens of several of our countries have been victims of truly terrible natural disasters.
reference_text: Although, as you will have seen, the dreaded 'millennium bug' failed to materialise, still the people in a number of countries suffered a series of natural disasters that truly were dreadful.

source_text: Como todos han podido comprobar, el gran "efecto del año 2000" no se ha producido. En cambio, los ciudadanos de varios de nuestros países han sido víctimas de catástrofes naturales verdaderamente terribles.
translated_text: As everyone has been able to verify, the much-feared "Year 2000 problem" did not materialize.  Instead, citizens in several of our countries have been victims of truly terrible natural disasters.
reference_text: Although, as you will have seen, the dreaded 'millennium bug' failed to materialise, still the people in a number of countries suffered a series of natural disasters that truly were dreadful.

source_text: A la espera de que se produzca, de acuerdo con muchos colegas que me lo han pedido, pido que hagamos un minuto de silencio en memoria de todas las víctimas de las tormentas, en los distintos países de la Unión Europea afectados.
translated_text: Pending this, in agreement with many colleagues who have asked me to do so, I would ask that we observe a minute's silence in memory of all the victims of the storms in the various countries of the European Union affected.
reference_text: In the meantime, I should like to observe a minute' s silence, as a number of Members have requested, on behalf of all the victims concerned, particularly those of the terrible storms, in the various countries of the European Union.

source_text: Una de las personas que recientemente han asesinado en Sri Lanka ha sido al Sr. Kumar Ponnambalam, quien hace pocos meses visitó el Parlamento Europeo.
translated_text: One of the people recently murdered in Sri Lanka was Mr Kumar Ponnambalam, who visited the European Parliament a few months ago.

source_text: ¿Sería apropiado que usted, Señora Presidenta, escribiese una carta al Presidente de Sri Lanka expresando las condolencias del Parlamento por esa y otras muertes violentas, pidiéndole que haga todo lo posible para encontrar una reconciliación pacífica ante la extremadamente difícil situación que está viviendo su país?
translated_text: Would it be appropriate for you, Madam President, to write a letter to the President of Sri Lanka expressing Parliament's condolences for this and other violent deaths, asking him to do all he can to find a peaceful reconciliation to the extremely difficult situation his country is experiencing?
reference_text: Would it be appropriate for you, Madam President, to write a letter to the Sri Lankan President expressing Parliament's regret at his and the other violent deaths in Sri Lanka and urging her to do everything she possibly can to seek a peaceful reconciliation to a very difficult situation?

source_text: El informe Cunha sobre los programas de dirección plurianual se presenta al Parlamento el jueves y contiene una propuesta en el apartado 6 en torno a una forma de penalizaciones basada en cuotas que debe aplicarse a los países que no cumplan anualmente sus objetivos de reducción de flota.
translated_text: The Cunha report on multi-annual guidance programmes is presented to Parliament on Thursday and contains a proposal in paragraph 6 for a form of quota-based penalties to be applied to countries that fail to meet their annual fleet reduction targets.
reference_text: The Cunha report on multiannual guidance programmes comes before Parliament on Thursday and contains a proposal in paragraph 6 that a form of quota penalties should be introduced for countries which fail to meet their fleet reduction targets annually.

reference_text: The Cunha report on multiannual guidance programmes comes before Parliament on Thursday and contains a proposal in paragraph 6 that a form of quota penalties should be introduced for countries which fail to meet their fleet reduction targets annually.

source_text: Creo que el principio de estabilidad relativa es un principio legal fundamental de las políticas pesqueras comunitarias, por lo que una propuesta que lo subvierta es legalmente inadmisible.
translated_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental legal principle of Community fisheries policies, so a proposal that subverts it is legally inadmissible.
reference_text: I believe that the principle of relative stability is a fundamental legal principle of the common fisheries policy and a proposal to subvert it would be legally inadmissible.

source_text: Quiero saber si se puede hacer este tipo de objeción a lo que sólo es un informe, no una propuesta legislativa, y si es algo que puedo plantear el jueves.
translated_text: I want to know whether this kind of objection can be made to what is only a report, not a legislative proposal, and whether it is something I can raise on Thursday.
reference_text: I want to know whether one can raise an objection of that kind to what is merely a report, not a legislative proposal, and whether that is something I can competently do on Thursday.

translated_text: The honourable Member may, if he so wishes, raise this issue at that time, i.e. on the Thursday before the report is presented.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, coincidiendo con el primer período parcial de sesiones de este año del Parlamento Europeo, lamentablemente, en los Estados Unidos, en Texas, se ha fijado para el próximo jueves la ejecución de un condenado a la pena capital, un joven de 34 años que llamaremos con el nombre de Hicks.
translated_text: Madam President, coinciding with this year's first part-session of the European Parliament, unfortunately, in the United States, in Texas, the execution has been scheduled for next Thursday of a man sentenced to death, a young man of 34 years of age whom we shall call Hicks.
reference_text: Madam President, coinciding with this year' s first part-session of the European Parliament, a date has been set, unfortunately for next Thursday, in Texas in America, for the execution of a young 34 year-old man who has been sentenced to death. We shall call him Mr Hicks.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, coincidiendo con el primer período parcial de sesiones de este año del Parlamento Europeo, lamentablemente, en los Estados Unidos, en Texas, se ha fijado para el próximo jueves la ejecución de un condenado a la pena capital, un joven de 34 años que llamaremos con el nombre de Hicks.
translated_text: Madam President, coinciding with the first part-session of this year of the European Parliament, sadly, in the United States, in Texas, the execution of a death row inmate, a 34-year-old man we will call Hicks, has been scheduled for next Thursday.
reference_text: Madam President, coinciding with this year' s first part-session of the European Parliament, a date has been set, unfortunately for next Thursday, in Texas in America, for the execution of a young 34 year-old man who has been sentenced to death. We shall call him Mr Hicks.

source_text: A petición de un diputado francés, el Sr. Zimeray, se ha presentado una solicitud, cuyos firmantes han sido numerosos y entre los cuales me cuento, sin embargo, de conformidad con la posición constantemente expresada por el Parlamento Europeo y por toda la Comunidad europea, le pido que intervenga con el prestigio de su cargo y de la Institución que representa ante el Presidente y el Gobernador del Estado de Texas, Sr. Bush, que tiene la facultad de suspender la condena a muerte y de indultar al condenado.
translated_text: At the request of a French Member of Parliament, Mr Zimeray, a request has been made, many of whose signatories have signed it, including myself, but, in accordance with the position constantly expressed by the European Parliament and the entire European Community, I would ask you to intervene with the prestige of your office and the institution you represent with the President and the Governor of the State of Texas, Mr Bush, who has the power to suspend the death sentence and to pardon the condemned man.
reference_text: At the request of a French Member, Mr Zimeray, a petition has already been presented, which many people signed, including myself. However, I would ask you, in accordance with the line which is now constantly followed by the European Parliament and by the whole of the European Community, to make representations, using the weight of your prestigious office and the institution you represent, to the President and to the Governor of Texas, Mr Bush, who has the power to order a stay of execution and to reprieve the condemned person.

source_text: A petición de un diputado francés, el Sr. Zimeray, se ha presentado una solicitud, cuyos firmantes han sido numerosos y entre los cuales me cuento, sin embargo, de conformidad con la posición constantemente expresada por el Parlamento Europeo y por toda la Comunidad europea, le pido que intervenga con el prestigio de su cargo y de la Institución que representa ante el Presidente y el Gobernador del Estado de Texas, Sr. Bush, que tiene la facultad de suspender la condena a muerte y de indultar al condenado.
translated_text: At the request of a French deputy, Mr. Zimeray, a petition has been submitted, signed by numerous individuals, myself included.  However, in accordance with the consistently expressed position of the European Parliament and the entire European Community, I ask that you intervene, using the prestige of your office and the Institution you represent, with the President and Governor of the State of Texas, Mr. Bush, who has the power to suspend the death sentence and pardon the condemned.

source_text: Todos celebramos aquí que el tribunal le haya declarado inocente y que haya puesto de manifiesto que también en Rusia el acceso a la información sobre el medio ambiente es un derecho constitucional.
translated_text: We all welcome the fact that the court has found him not guilty and that it has shown that in Russia, too, access to environmental information is a constitutional right.
reference_text: All of us here are pleased that the courts have acquitted him and made it clear that in Russia, too, access to environmental information is a constitutional right.

source_text: Todos celebramos aquí que el tribunal le haya declarado inocente y que haya puesto de manifiesto que también en Rusia el acceso a la información sobre el medio ambiente es un derecho constitucional.

source_text: Sin embargo, sucede que va a ser acusado de nuevo, pues el fiscal interpondrá un recurso.
translated_text: However, it so happens that he will be charged again, as the prosecutor will lodge an appeal.
reference_text: Now, however, he is to go before the courts once more because the public prosecutor is appealing.

translated_text: However, it turns out that he is going to be charged again, as the prosecutor will file an appeal.
reference_text: Now, however, he is to go before the courts once more because the public prosecutor is appealing.

source_text: Sabemos y lo hemos afirmado realmente en muchas resoluciones -precisamente en la última sesión plenaria del año pasado- que éste no es solamente un caso jurídico y que es un error acusar a Alexander Nikitin de conducta criminal y de traición, porque nosotros, como afectados por sus resultados, obtengamos provecho de ella.
translated_text: We know, and we have actually stated this in many resolutions - and we did so at the last plenary session last year - that this is not just a legal case and that it is wrong to accuse Alexander Nikitin of criminal behaviour and treason because we, as those affected by its results, profit from it.
reference_text: We know, and we have stated as much in very many resolutions indeed, including specifically during the last plenary part-session of last year, that this is not solely a legal case and that it is wrong for Alexander Nikitin to be accused of criminal activity and treason because of our involvement as the beneficiaries of his findings.

source_text: Sabemos y lo hemos afirmado realmente en muchas resoluciones -precisamente en la última sesión plenaria del año pasado- que éste no es solamente un caso jurídico y que es un error acusar a Alexander Nikitin de conducta criminal y de traición, porque nosotros, como afectados por sus resultados, obtengamos provecho de ella.
translated_text: We know, and have indeed stated in many resolutions – specifically in last year's final plenary session – that this is not merely a legal case and that it is a mistake to accuse Alexander Nikitin of criminal conduct and treason, because we, as those affected by its results, benefit from it.
reference_text: We know, and we have stated as much in very many resolutions indeed, including specifically during the last plenary part-session of last year, that this is not solely a legal case and that it is wrong for Alexander Nikitin to be accused of criminal activity and treason because of our involvement as the beneficiaries of his findings.

translated_text: We know and have actually stated in many resolutions - precisely in the last plenary session of last year - that this is not just a legal case and that it is a mistake to accuse Alexander Nikitin of criminal conduct and treason, because we, as those affected by its results, would benefit from it.
reference_text: We know, and we have stated as much in very many resolutions indeed, including specifically during the last plenary part-session of last year, that this is not solely a legal case and that it is wrong for Alexander Nikitin to be accused of criminal activity and treason because of our involvement as the beneficiaries of his findings.

source_text: Esos resultados constituyen la base de los programas europeos del mar de Barent y, por ello, le pido que estudie un borrador de carta que le describe los hechos más relevantes y que haga patente a Rusia esta posición que es acorde con las decisiones del Parlamento.
translated_text: These results form the basis of the European Barents Sea programmes and I therefore ask you to study a draft letter outlining the most relevant facts and to make this position, which is in line with Parliament's decisions, clear to Russia.
reference_text: These findings form the basis of the European programmes to protect the Barents Sea, and that is why I would ask you to examine a draft letter setting out the most important facts and to make Parliament's position, as expressed in the resolutions which it has adopted, clear as far as Russia is concerned.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, en primer lugar me gustaría felicitarla por haber cumplido con su promesa ya que efectivamente en este primer periodo de sesiones del año nuevo se ha ampliado drásticamente el número de canales en nuestros despachos.
translated_text: Madam President, first of all I would like to congratulate you on having fulfilled your promise, because in this first part-session of the new year the number of channels in our offices has been drastically increased.
reference_text: Madam President, I would firstly like to compliment you on the fact that you have kept your word and that, during this first part-session of the new year, the number of television channels in our offices has indeed increased considerably.

source_text: Bien es verdad que ahora hay dos canales finlandeses y uno portugués, pero aún no hay ninguno neerlandés y yo le había pedido un canal neerlandés, porque también los neerlandeses quisiéramos escuchar las noticias cada mes, cuando nos mandan a este exilio.
translated_text: It is true that there are now two Finnish channels and one Portuguese channel, but there are still no Dutch channels, and I had asked him for a Dutch channel, because we Dutch people would also like to hear the news every month when we are sent into exile.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, la presentación del programa político de la Comisión Prodi para toda la legislatura fue inicialmente una propuesta del Grupo del Partido de los Socialistas Europeos que logró la unanimidad de la Conferencia de Presidentes en septiembre y también la aceptación explícita del Presidente Prodi, que reiteró su compromiso en su discurso de investidura.
translated_text: Madam President, the presentation of the political programme of the Prodi Commission for the whole legislature was initially a proposal by the Group of the Party of European Socialists which achieved unanimity at the Conference of Presidents in September and also the explicit acceptance of President Prodi, who reiterated his commitment in his inaugural speech.
reference_text: Madam President, the presentation of the Prodi Commission' s political programme for the whole legislature was initially a proposal by the Group of the Party of European Socialists which was unanimously approved by the Conference of Presidents in September and which was also explicitly accepted by President Prodi, who reiterated his commitment in his inaugural speech.

source_text: Tiene importancia este compromiso en la medida en que la Comisión es un organismo que tiene el monopolio de la iniciativa de acuerdo con los Tratados y, por lo tanto, configura básicamente lo que va a ser la actividad política y legislativa de este Parlamento en los próximos cincos años.
translated_text: This commitment is important insofar as the Commission is a body that has a monopoly on initiative under the Treaties and, therefore, basically shapes what will be the political and legislative activity of this Parliament over the next five years.
reference_text: This commitment is important because the Commission is a body with a monopoly of initiative in accordance with the Treaties and, therefore, basically dictates this Parliament' s political and legislative activity for the next five years.

source_text: Recuerdo además, señora Presidenta, que este Parlamento votó en dos ocasiones en la anterior legislatura su confianza en el Presidente Prodi; en esta legislatura la votó de nuevo en julio y después, con la nueva Comisión en funciones, volvió en septiembre a darle un voto de confianza a toda la Comisión.
translated_text: I would also remind you, Madam President, that this Parliament voted its confidence in President Prodi on two occasions during the previous legislature; during this legislature it voted again in July and then, with the new Commission in office, it voted again in September to give a vote of confidence to the whole Commission.
reference_text: I would also like to point out, Madam President, that this Parliament voted to express its confidence in President Prodi during the previous legislature. It did so again during this legislature, in July, and then, in September, it voted once more to approve the whole Commission.

source_text: Recuerdo además, señora Presidenta, que este Parlamento votó en dos ocasiones en la anterior legislatura su confianza en el Presidente Prodi; en esta legislatura la votó de nuevo en julio y después, con la nueva Comisión en funciones, volvió en septiembre a darle un voto de confianza a toda la Comisión.

source_text: Los hechos ocurridos la semana pasada -que se han originado al margen de la Conferencia de Presidentes y utilizándola sólo para corroborar y ratificar decisiones tomadas fuera de ella- plantean un dilema: o bien la Comisión no está en condiciones de presentar ese programa (en ese caso convendría que lo aclarara.
translated_text: The events of the past week - originating outside the Conference of Presidents and using it only to corroborate and ratify decisions taken outside it - pose a dilemma: either the Commission is not in a position to present such a programme (in which case it would do well to clarify it) or it is not in a position to present such a programme.
reference_text: The events of last week - which originated outside the Conference of Presidents, that Conference being used simply to corroborate and ratify decisions taken elsewhere - present us with a dilemma. Either the Commission is not ready to present this programme, in which case it should clarify it.

Either the Commission is not ready to present this programme, in which case it should clarify it.

source_text: Dado que la Comisión está representada por la Vicepresidenta, Sra. de Palacio, creo que antes de votar sería conveniente conocer la situación de la Comisión en relación con su disponibilidad para presentar el programa, tal como se había convenido); o bien el Parlamento no está en condiciones de examinar este programa, como parece que pretenden algunos.
translated_text: Given that the Commission is represented by the Vice-President, Mrs de Palacio, I think that before voting, it would be useful to know the Commission's position as regards its willingness to present the programme, as agreed, or else Parliament is not in a position to examine this programme, as some people seem to be claiming.
reference_text: Given that the Commission is represented by Vice-President de Palacio, I believe that, before voting, it would help if the Commission could let us know how ready it is to present this programme, as agreed. Alternatively, Parliament is not ready to examine this programme, as some appear to be suggesting.

source_text: Dado que la Comisión está representada por la Vicepresidenta, Sra. de Palacio, creo que antes de votar sería conveniente conocer la situación de la Comisión en relación con su disponibilidad para presentar el programa, tal como se había convenido); o bien el Parlamento no está en condiciones de examinar este programa, como parece que pretenden algunos.
translated_text: Given that the Commission is represented by the Vice-President, Ms. de Palacio, I believe that before voting it would be advisable to know the Commission's position regarding its availability to present the programme, as agreed; otherwise, Parliament is not in a position to examine this programme, as some seem to intend.

Alternatively, Parliament is not ready to examine this programme, as some appear to be suggesting.

Alternatively, Parliament is not ready to examine this programme, as some appear to be suggesting.

source_text: En mi opinión, esta segunda hipótesis significaría hacer dejación de nuestras responsabilidades como Parlamento, además de introducir una tesis original, un método desconocido consistente en dar a conocer a los grupos políticos por escrito el discurso programático de la Comisión una semana antes -y no el día antes, como se había convenido-, teniendo en cuenta que el programa legislativo se discutirá en febrero, de tal manera que podríamos prescindir del debate, porque al día siguiente la prensa e Internet lo habrían dado a conocer a todos los ciudadanos y el Parlamento no tendría ya por qué ocuparse del asunto.
translated_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would mean abandoning our responsibilities as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method consisting of making the Commission's programme speech known to the political groups in writing a week before - and not the day before, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so that we could dispense with the debate, because the following day the press and the Internet would have made it known to all citizens and Parliament would no longer need to concern itself with the matter.
reference_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would imply the failure of Parliament in its duty as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method which consists of making political groups aware, in writing, of a speech concerning the Commission' s programme a week earlier - and not a day earlier, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so we could forego the debate, since on the next day our citizens will hear about it in the press and on the Internet and Parliament will no longer have to worry about it.

source_text: En mi opinión, esta segunda hipótesis significaría hacer dejación de nuestras responsabilidades como Parlamento, además de introducir una tesis original, un método desconocido consistente en dar a conocer a los grupos políticos por escrito el discurso programático de la Comisión una semana antes -y no el día antes, como se había convenido-, teniendo en cuenta que el programa legislativo se discutirá en febrero, de tal manera que podríamos prescindir del debate, porque al día siguiente la prensa e Internet lo habrían dado a conocer a todos los ciudadanos y el Parlamento no tendría ya por qué ocuparse del asunto.
translated_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would mean shirking our responsibilities as Parliament, in addition to introducing an original thesis, an unknown method consisting of providing political groups with the Commission's programmatic speech in writing one week beforehand – and not the day before, as agreed – bearing in mind that the legislative program will be discussed in February, in such a way that we could dispense with the debate, because the following day the press and internet would have made it known to all citizens and Parliament would no longer need to deal with the matter.
reference_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would imply the failure of Parliament in its duty as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method which consists of making political groups aware, in writing, of a speech concerning the Commission' s programme a week earlier - and not a day earlier, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so we could forego the debate, since on the next day our citizens will hear about it in the press and on the Internet and Parliament will no longer have to worry about it.

reference_text: In my opinion, this second hypothesis would imply the failure of Parliament in its duty as a Parliament, as well as introducing an original thesis, an unknown method which consists of making political groups aware, in writing, of a speech concerning the Commission' s programme a week earlier - and not a day earlier, as had been agreed - bearing in mind that the legislative programme will be discussed in February, so we could forego the debate, since on the next day our citizens will hear about it in the press and on the Internet and Parliament will no longer have to worry about it.

source_text: Como mi Grupo opina que un Parlamento está hecho para escuchar, para debatir y para reflexionar, pensamos que no hay razón alguna que justifique este aplazamiento y creemos que si, la Comisión está en condiciones de hacerlo, estamos perfectamente a tiempo para poder restablecer el acuerdo original entre el Parlamento y la Comisión y proceder con responsabilidad ante nuestras conciudadanas y nuestros conciudadanos.
translated_text: As my group believes that a Parliament is made to listen, to debate and to reflect, we believe that there is no reason to justify this postponement and we believe that, if the Commission is in a position to do so, we are perfectly in time to be able to re-establish the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and to proceed responsibly before our fellow citizens.
reference_text: My Group believes that since a parliament is meant to listen, debate and reflect, there can be no justification whatsoever for this delay and we believe that, if the Commission is ready to do so, we still have time to re-establish the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and proceed in a manner which fulfils our duty to our fellow citizens.

source_text: Como mi Grupo opina que un Parlamento está hecho para escuchar, para debatir y para reflexionar, pensamos que no hay razón alguna que justifique este aplazamiento y creemos que si, la Comisión está en condiciones de hacerlo, estamos perfectamente a tiempo para poder restablecer el acuerdo original entre el Parlamento y la Comisión y proceder con responsabilidad ante nuestras conciudadanas y nuestros conciudadanos.
translated_text: Since my group believes that a Parliament is made for listening, debating, and reflection, we think there is no reason to justify this postponement. We believe that if the Commission is able to do so, we are perfectly on time to restore the original agreement between the Parliament and the Commission and proceed responsibly towards our fellow citizens.
reference_text: My Group believes that since a parliament is meant to listen, debate and reflect, there can be no justification whatsoever for this delay and we believe that, if the Commission is ready to do so, we still have time to re-establish the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and proceed in a manner which fulfils our duty to our fellow citizens.

source_text: Como mi Grupo opina que un Parlamento está hecho para escuchar, para debatir y para reflexionar, pensamos que no hay razón alguna que justifique este aplazamiento y creemos que si, la Comisión está en condiciones de hacerlo, estamos perfectamente a tiempo para poder restablecer el acuerdo original entre el Parlamento y la Comisión y proceder con responsabilidad ante nuestras conciudadanas y nuestros conciudadanos.
translated_text: As my Group believes that a Parliament is made to listen, to debate and to reflect, we think that there is no reason that justifies this postponement and we believe that if the Commission is in a position to do so, we are perfectly on time to be able to restore the original agreement between the Parliament and the Commission and to proceed with responsibility before our fellow citizens.
reference_text: My Group believes that since a parliament is meant to listen, debate and reflect, there can be no justification whatsoever for this delay and we believe that, if the Commission is ready to do so, we still have time to re-establish the original agreement between Parliament and the Commission and proceed in a manner which fulfils our duty to our fellow citizens.

source_text: Por lo tanto, la propuesta que hace el Grupo del Partido de los Socialistas Europeos y que su Señoría ha mencionado es que el miércoles se mantenga la presentación del programa de legislatura de la Comisión Prodi, incluyendo dentro de este programa también el proyecto de reforma administrativa porque, de no ser así, nos podemos encontrar con una situación paradójica: con la excusa de que no hay texto, se niega por una parte el derecho al Presidente de la Comisión a hablar en este Parlamento y, por otra parte, que tenga lugar un debate sobre la reforma sin que este Parlamento conozca previamente los textos en que se basa.
translated_text: Therefore, the proposal made by the Group of the Party of European Socialists and mentioned by the honourable Member is that on Wednesday the presentation of the Prodi Commission's programme for the parliamentary term should continue, including the administrative reform project within this programme because, otherwise, we may find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: with the excuse that there is no text, on the one hand, the President of the Commission is denied the right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other, that a debate on the reform should take place without this Parliament having prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.
reference_text: Therefore, the proposal of the Group of the Party of European Socialists, and which you have mentioned, is that the Prodi Commission present its legislative programme on Wednesday, including its proposed administrative reform, because, otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: on the pretext that there is no text, on the one hand, the President of the Commission would be denied his right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other hand, there would be a debate on a reform when Parliament had no prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.

source_text: Por lo tanto, la propuesta que hace el Grupo del Partido de los Socialistas Europeos y que su Señoría ha mencionado es que el miércoles se mantenga la presentación del programa de legislatura de la Comisión Prodi, incluyendo dentro de este programa también el proyecto de reforma administrativa porque, de no ser así, nos podemos encontrar con una situación paradójica: con la excusa de que no hay texto, se niega por una parte el derecho al Presidente de la Comisión a hablar en este Parlamento y, por otra parte, que tenga lugar un debate sobre la reforma sin que este Parlamento conozca previamente los textos en que se basa.
translated_text: Therefore, the proposal made by the Group of the Party of European Socialists, and which Your Honour has mentioned, is that the presentation of the Prodi Commission's legislative programme should be held on Wednesday, including within this programme the draft administrative reform.  Otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: under the pretext that there is no text, the Commission President's right to speak in this Parliament would be denied, and a debate on the reform would take place without this Parliament having prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.
reference_text: Therefore, the proposal of the Group of the Party of European Socialists, and which you have mentioned, is that the Prodi Commission present its legislative programme on Wednesday, including its proposed administrative reform, because, otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: on the pretext that there is no text, on the one hand, the President of the Commission would be denied his right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other hand, there would be a debate on a reform when Parliament had no prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.

source_text: Por lo tanto, la propuesta que hace el Grupo del Partido de los Socialistas Europeos y que su Señoría ha mencionado es que el miércoles se mantenga la presentación del programa de legislatura de la Comisión Prodi, incluyendo dentro de este programa también el proyecto de reforma administrativa porque, de no ser así, nos podemos encontrar con una situación paradójica: con la excusa de que no hay texto, se niega por una parte el derecho al Presidente de la Comisión a hablar en este Parlamento y, por otra parte, que tenga lugar un debate sobre la reforma sin que este Parlamento conozca previamente los textos en que se basa.
translated_text: Therefore, the proposal made by the Group of the Party of European Socialists and mentioned by Your Lordship is that on Wednesday the presentation of the Prodi Commission's legislative programme be maintained, including within this programme also the administrative reform project, because if not, we may find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: under the pretext that there is no text, the right of the President of the Commission to speak in this Parliament is denied on the one hand, and on the other hand, a debate on the reform takes place without this Parliament knowing in advance the texts on which it is based.
reference_text: Therefore, the proposal of the Group of the Party of European Socialists, and which you have mentioned, is that the Prodi Commission present its legislative programme on Wednesday, including its proposed administrative reform, because, otherwise, we could find ourselves in a paradoxical situation: on the pretext that there is no text, on the one hand, the President of the Commission would be denied his right to speak in this Parliament and, on the other hand, there would be a debate on a reform when Parliament had no prior knowledge of the texts on which it is based.

source_text: Por lo tanto, le ruego, señora Presidenta, que pida a la Comisión que se manifieste en este momento y después que se proceda al voto.

reference_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would ask you to request that the Commission express its opinion on this issue and that we then proceed to the vote.

reference_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would ask you to request that the Commission express its opinion on this issue and that we then proceed to the vote.

source_text: . Señora Presidenta, quiero dejar muy claro que, ante todo, la Comisión tiene el máximo respeto por las decisiones de este Parlamento y, entre ellas, la de establecer su orden del día.
translated_text: . (ES) Madam President, I would like to make it very clear that, above all, the Commission has the utmost respect for the decisions of this Parliament, including the decision to establish its agenda.
reference_text: Madam President, I would like to make it very clear that, above all, the Commission has absolute respect for the decisions of this Parliament and, amongst those, the decision establishing its agenda.

reference_text: Madam President, I would like to make it very clear that, above all, the Commission has absolute respect for the decisions of this Parliament and, amongst those, the decision establishing its agenda.

source_text: Por lo tanto, nosotros respetamos lo que en este sentido pueda decidir el Parlamento.
translated_text: We therefore respect what Parliament may decide in this regard.
reference_text: We therefore respect whatever Parliament may decide.

source_text: Pero quiero dejar también muy claro que el Presidente Prodi se comprometió con el Parlamento a incorporar un nuevo debate, como ha recordado el Sr. Barón, que se añade al debate anual sobre el programa legislativo de la Comisión, sobre las grandes líneas de actuación para el próximo período de cinco años, es decir, para esta legislatura.
translated_text: But I would also like to make it very clear that President Prodi made a commitment to Parliament to incorporate a new debate, as Mr Barón Crespo pointed out, which is in addition to the annual debate on the Commission's legislative programme, on the broad lines of action for the next five-year period, that is to say, for this legislature.
reference_text: But I would also like to make it very clear that President Prodi made a commitment to this Parliament to introduce a new debate, as Mr Barón Crespo has reminded us, which would be in addition to the annual debate on the Commission' s legislative programme, on the broad areas of action for the next five years, that is to say, for this legislature.

source_text: Pero quiero dejar también muy claro que el Presidente Prodi se comprometió con el Parlamento a incorporar un nuevo debate, como ha recordado el Sr. Barón, que se añade al debate anual sobre el programa legislativo de la Comisión, sobre las grandes líneas de actuación para el próximo período de cinco años, es decir, para esta legislatura.
translated_text: However, I also want to make it very clear that President Prodi committed to Parliament to incorporate a new debate, as Mr Barón has reminded us, in addition to the annual debate on the Commission's legislative programme, on the main lines of action for the next five-year period, i.e. for this legislature.

source_text: Quiero decir, señora Presidenta, que este debate se distinguía, en el acuerdo al que se llegó en el mes de septiembre, de lo que es la presentación anual del programa legislativo de la Comisión.
translated_text: I would like to say, Madam President, that this debate was distinguished, in the agreement reached in September, from the annual presentation of the Commission's legislative programme.
reference_text: Madam President, I would like to say that the agreement reached in September distinguished this debate from the annual presentation of the Commission' s legislative programme.

source_text: Quiero decir, señora Presidenta, que este debate se distinguía, en el acuerdo al que se llegó en el mes de septiembre, de lo que es la presentación anual del programa legislativo de la Comisión.

source_text: Quiero decir, señora Presidenta, que este debate se distinguía, en el acuerdo al que se llegó en el mes de septiembre, de lo que es la presentación anual del programa legislativo de la Comisión.
translated_text: I mean, Madam President, that this debate was distinguished, in the agreement reached in September, from what is the annual presentation of the Commission's legislative programme.
reference_text: Madam President, I would like to say that the agreement reached in September distinguished this debate from the annual presentation of the Commission' s legislative programme.

source_text: Y quiero decir, señora Presidenta, que, por parte de la Comisión, estamos preparados y dispuestos a tener ese debate cuando convenga, que estábamos preparados para desarrollarlo esta semana, como en principio se había acordado, partiendo de la base de que se presentaba la víspera en un discurso a los grupos parlamentarios.
translated_text: And I would like to say, Madam President, that, on the part of the Commission, we are ready and willing to hold this debate when it is appropriate, that we were prepared to hold it this week, as agreed in principle, on the basis that it was presented the day before in a speech to the parliamentary groups.
reference_text: I would also like to say that the Commission is prepared and ready to hold this debate whenever it is convenient and that we were ready to do so this week as we had agreed originally, on the basis that it would be presented the day before in a speech to parliamentary groups.

source_text: Y quiero decir, señora Presidenta, que, por parte de la Comisión, estamos preparados y dispuestos a tener ese debate cuando convenga, que estábamos preparados para desarrollarlo esta semana, como en principio se había acordado, partiendo de la base de que se presentaba la víspera en un discurso a los grupos parlamentarios.
translated_text: And I want to say, Madam President, that, on behalf of the Commission, we are prepared and willing to have that debate when convenient, that we were prepared to hold it this week, as was initially agreed, on the understanding that it would be presented the previous day in a speech to the parliamentary groups.
reference_text: I would also like to say that the Commission is prepared and ready to hold this debate whenever it is convenient and that we were ready to do so this week as we had agreed originally, on the basis that it would be presented the day before in a speech to parliamentary groups.

translated_text: And I mean, Madam President, that on the part of the Commission, we are prepared and willing to have that debate whenever it is convenient, that we were prepared to develop it this week, as had been agreed in principle, based on the fact that it was presented the day before in a speech to the parliamentary groups.
reference_text: I would also like to say that the Commission is prepared and ready to hold this debate whenever it is convenient and that we were ready to do so this week as we had agreed originally, on the basis that it would be presented the day before in a speech to parliamentary groups.

source_text: Por lo tanto, señora Presidenta, quiero reiterar que, por nuestra parte, hemos debatido el programa de actuación para los próximos cinco años y que estamos preparados para, cuando así lo decida el Parlamento, -esta misma semana si ésa es la decisión- venir a exponer el programa para los próximos cinco años y, el mes que viene, el programa para el año 2000, que era lo que estaba perfectamente acordado.
translated_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would like to reiterate that, for our part, we have debated the action programme for the next five years and that we are prepared, when Parliament so decides - this very week if that is the decision - to come and present the programme for the next five years and, next month, the programme for the year 2000, which was perfectly agreed.
reference_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would like to repeat that the Commission has debated the action plan for the next five years and, when Parliament decides, - this week if that is the decision - we are prepared to come and explain the programme for the next five years and, next month, the programme for 2000, which is what we fully agreed upon.

translated_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would like to reiterate that, on our part, we have debated the action programme for the next five years and that we are prepared to, when the Parliament so decides - this very week if that is the decision - come and present the programme for the next five years and, next month, the programme for the year 2000, which was perfectly agreed upon.
reference_text: Therefore, Madam President, I would like to repeat that the Commission has debated the action plan for the next five years and, when Parliament decides, - this week if that is the decision - we are prepared to come and explain the programme for the next five years and, next month, the programme for 2000, which is what we fully agreed upon.

source_text: Me han dicho que también amplios círculos del Grupo Socialista ven de buen grado la supresión de este punto del orden del día, ya que en la votación habida en la Conferencia de Presidentes faltó el voto del grupo de trabajo competente para ello de nuestros colegas del Grupo Socialista.
translated_text: I have been told that there are also broad sections of the Socialist Group in the European Parliament who welcome the removal of this item from the agenda, because the vote in the Conference of Presidents did not include the vote of the competent working party of our colleagues in the Socialist Group.
reference_text: I was told that large sections of the Socialist Group were also keen to have this item taken off the agenda, because at the vote in the Conference of Presidents no vote was received from the working group of Members of the Socialist Group responsible for this matter.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, ante todo quiero subrayar la falta de lógica del señor Poettering, que acaba de dar una lección al Grupo de los Socialista Europeos para que se vuelva a tratar una decisión que se tomó de un modo absolutamente claro en la Conferencia de Presidentes. Y él hace lo mismo.
translated_text: (ES) Madam President, I would first of all like to stress the lack of logic of Mr Poettering, who has just taught the Group of the Party of European Socialists a lesson in order to reopen a decision that was taken quite clearly at the Conference of Presidents. And he is doing the same.
reference_text: Madam President, I would firstly like to point out Mr Poettering' s lack of logic. He has just been preaching to the Group of the Party of European Socialists because they went back on a decision taken in a perfectly clear manner at the Conference of Presidents, and now he is doing just the same.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, ante todo quiero subrayar la falta de lógica del señor Poettering, que acaba de dar una lección al Grupo de los Socialista Europeos para que se vuelva a tratar una decisión que se tomó de un modo absolutamente claro en la Conferencia de Presidentes. Y él hace lo mismo.
translated_text: Madam President, first of all, I want to highlight the illogic of Mr Poettering, who has just lectured the Socialist Group in the European Parliament to reconsider a decision that was taken in a perfectly clear manner at the Conference of Presidents. And he does the same.
reference_text: Madam President, I would firstly like to point out Mr Poettering' s lack of logic. He has just been preaching to the Group of the Party of European Socialists because they went back on a decision taken in a perfectly clear manner at the Conference of Presidents, and now he is doing just the same.

translated_text: Madam President, first of all I want to stress the lack of logic of Mr Poettering, who has just given the Group of the European Socialists a lesson to have a decision re-examined which was taken in a perfectly clear manner at the Conference of Presidents, and he is doing exactly the same thing.
reference_text: Madam President, I would firstly like to point out Mr Poettering' s lack of logic. He has just been preaching to the Group of the Party of European Socialists because they went back on a decision taken in a perfectly clear manner at the Conference of Presidents, and now he is doing just the same.

source_text: Hemos discutido, expresamos unanimidad, con excepción de los Grupos del PPE y del Partido Europeo de los Liberales Demócratas y Reformistas, y yo mismo hice notar -como lo recordarán mis queridos compañeros presidentes- que no se trata de saber si están ustedes a favor o en contra del impuesto Todin, sino de saber si se atreven a comprender lo que piensan al respecto la Comisión y el Consejo.
translated_text: We discussed it, we expressed unanimity, with the exception of the PPE and the Group of the European Liberal, Democrat and Reform Party, and I myself pointed out - as my fellow Presidents will remember - that it is not a question of knowing whether you are for or against the Todin tax, but of knowing whether you dare to understand what the Commission and the Council think about it.
reference_text: We discussed that matter and we were unanimous, with the exception of the PPE and ELDR Groups. As my fellow chairmen will recall, I even mentioned that it was not a matter of knowing whether one was for or against the Tobin tax, but of whether one dared to hear what the Commission and the Council thought of it.

As my fellow chairmen will recall, I even mentioned that it was not a matter of knowing whether one was for or against the Tobin tax, but of whether one dared to hear what the Commission and the Council thought of it.

source_text: Por lo tanto, reitero la propuesta de mantener esta pregunta oral a la Comisión y al Consejo para saber de una vez por todas cuál es la posición de esos dos órganos en lo que se refiere a esta propuesta relativamente modesta, pero que sería una señal importante para la opinión, sobre todo después de la conmoción que suscitó el fracaso de la Conferencia de Seattle.
translated_text: I therefore reiterate the proposal to maintain this oral question to the Commission and the Council in order to find out once and for all what the position of these two bodies is with regard to this relatively modest proposal, but which would be an important signal to the public, especially after the commotion caused by the failure of the Seattle Conference.
reference_text: I therefore repeat the proposal that this oral question to the Commission and the Council should be retained so that we can find out, once and for all, the positions of these two bodies regarding the proposal which is relatively modest but which would give a clear message to public opinion, particularly after the tide of feeling generated by the failure of the Seattle Conference.

translated_text: Therefore, I reiterate the proposal to put this question orally to the Commission and the Council to find out once and for all what the position of those two bodies is regarding this relatively modest proposal, which would, however, be an important signal to public opinion, especially after the shock caused by the failure of the Seattle Conference.
reference_text: I therefore repeat the proposal that this oral question to the Commission and the Council should be retained so that we can find out, once and for all, the positions of these two bodies regarding the proposal which is relatively modest but which would give a clear message to public opinion, particularly after the tide of feeling generated by the failure of the Seattle Conference.

source_text: Cuando mañana se trate la aprobación del Acta de la sesión de hoy, si Sus Señorías estiman que las posiciones no se han explicado lo bastante bien, podrán pedir modificaciones.

reference_text: Of course, the Minutes for tomorrow' s sitting will take into account any additional explanations.

source_text: Creo que esta fórmula es mejor que la de proceder ahora a unas explicaciones de voto que nos llevarían mucho tiempo.
translated_text: I believe that this formula is better than proceeding now to time-consuming explanations of vote.
reference_text: I think this is a better solution than proceeding now to extremely time-consuming explanations of votes.

source_text: Creo que esta fórmula es mejor que la de proceder ahora a unas explicaciones de voto que nos llevarían mucho tiempo.

source_text: Sr. Hänsch, Sr. Cox, ¿les parece bien?
translated_text: Mr Hänsch, Mr Cox, is that all right?
reference_text: Mr Cox, Mr Hänsch, would this be acceptable to you?

source_text: Señora Presidenta, si en el registro de la votación consta correctamente cómo ha votado mi Grupo, ni quiero ni puedo plantear objeción alguna.
translated_text: Madam President, if the voting record shows correctly how my group voted, I neither wish nor am able to raise any objection.
reference_text: Madam President, if the vote records correctly how my Group voted I shall not, and cannot, object to that.

source_text: Señora Presidenta, si en el registro de la votación consta correctamente cómo ha votado mi Grupo, ni quiero ni puedo plantear objeción alguna.

reference_text: Madam President, if the vote records correctly how my Group voted I shall not, and cannot, object to that.

source_text: Si su decisión es que no podemos explicar nuestro voto, la acataré, pero no sin reservas.
translated_text: If your decision is that we cannot explain our vote, I will abide by it, but not without reservations.
reference_text: If your ruling is that I cannot give an explanation of vote, I accept that but with reservations.

source_text: De conformidad con el orden del día, se procede al debate de la recomendación para la segunda lectura (A5-0105/1999) respecto de la posición común del Consejo con vistas a la adopción de la directiva del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo relativa a los requisitos mínimos aplicables al examen de los consejeros de seguridad para el transporte de mercancías peligrosas por carretera, ferrocarril o por vía navegable (C5-0208/1999 - 1998/0106(COD)). (Comisión de Política Regional, Transporte y Turismo) (Ponente : Dieter-Lebrecht Koch).
translated_text: The next item is the recommendation for second reading (A5-0105/1999 ) on the Council common position for adopting a European Parliament and Council directive on minimum examination requirements for safety advisers for the transport of dangerous goods by road, rail or inland waterway (C5-0208/1999 - 1998/0106(COD)). (Committee on Regional Policy, Transport and Tourism) (Rapporteur: Dieter-Lebrecht Koch).
reference_text: The next item is the report (A5-0105/1999) by Mr Koch, on behalf of the Committee on Regional Policy, Transport and Tourism, on the common position adopted by the Council with a view to adopting a European Parliament and Council directive on the harmonisation of examination requirements for safety advisers for the transport of dangerous goods by road, rail or inland waterways (C5-0208/1999 - 1998/0106(COD)).

(Comisión de Política Regional, Transporte y Turismo) (Ponente : Dieter-Lebrecht Koch).

(Committee on Regional Policy, Transport and Tourism) (Rapporteur: Dieter-Lebrecht Koch).

source_text: . (DE) Distinguida señora Comisaria, distinguida señora Presidenta, estimados colegas, celebro sobremanera la posición común del Consejo sobre la armonización de la formación de los consejeros de seguridad para el transporte de mercancías peligrosas por carretera, por ferrocarril o por vías navegables.
translated_text: (DE) Commissioner, Madam President, ladies and gentlemen, I very much welcome the Council's common position on harmonising the training of safety advisers for the transport of dangerous goods by road, rail and inland waterway.
reference_text: Commissioner, Madam President, ladies and gentlemen, I can be quite frank in saying that I welcome the Council's common position on harmonising the training of safety advisers for the transport of dangerous goods by road, rail or inland waterway.

reference_text: Commissioner, Madam President, ladies and gentlemen, I can be quite frank in saying that I welcome the Council's common position on harmonising the training of safety advisers for the transport of dangerous goods by road, rail or inland waterway.

source_text: En primer lugar: hemos tenido que actuar en el terreno formal para satisfacer las exigencias de la Directiva 96/35/CE que obliga a los Estados miembros a la implantación de encargados de la prevención de riesgos inherentes a las mercancías peligrosas o consejeros de seguridad, así como a la organización, escolarización y examen de estas personas, sin especificar esto de manera explícita.
translated_text: Firstly, we have had to act formally to meet the requirements of Directive 96/35/EC, which obliges Member States to set up risk prevention officers or safety advisers for dangerous goods and to organise, train and examine these people, without specifying this explicitly.
reference_text: Firstly, we needed to take action on a formal level in order to meet the requirements of Directive 96/35/EC, which obliges the Member States to appoint safety advisers and to organise the training, instruction and examination of these people but does not explain this explicitly.

source_text: En primer lugar: hemos tenido que actuar en el terreno formal para satisfacer las exigencias de la Directiva 96/35/CE que obliga a los Estados miembros a la implantación de encargados de la prevención de riesgos inherentes a las mercancías peligrosas o consejeros de seguridad, así como a la organización, escolarización y examen de estas personas, sin especificar esto de manera explícita.
translated_text: First, we had to act formally to meet the requirements of Directive 96/35/EC, which obliges Member States to implement risk prevention officers for dangerous goods or safety advisors, as well as the organization, training, and examination of these individuals, without explicitly specifying this.
reference_text: Firstly, we needed to take action on a formal level in order to meet the requirements of Directive 96/35/EC, which obliges the Member States to appoint safety advisers and to organise the training, instruction and examination of these people but does not explain this explicitly.

source_text: En primer lugar: hemos tenido que actuar en el terreno formal para satisfacer las exigencias de la Directiva 96/35/CE que obliga a los Estados miembros a la implantación de encargados de la prevención de riesgos inherentes a las mercancías peligrosas o consejeros de seguridad, así como a la organización, escolarización y examen de estas personas, sin especificar esto de manera explícita.
translated_text: Firstly: we have had to act in the formal field to meet the requirements of Directive 96/35/EC which obliges Member States to the implementation of persons responsible for the prevention of risks inherent to dangerous goods or safety advisers, as well as the organization, training and examination of these persons, without specifying this in an explicit manner.
reference_text: Firstly, we needed to take action on a formal level in order to meet the requirements of Directive 96/35/EC, which obliges the Member States to appoint safety advisers and to organise the training, instruction and examination of these people but does not explain this explicitly.

source_text: En segundo lugar: con esta directiva pretendemos: a) aumentar la seguridad tanto en el transporte como en el transbordo de mercancías peligrosas; b)reducir las distorsiones de la competencia que se siguen de la existencia de muy diferentes estructuras nacionales de formación y de costes, así como c) establecer la igualdad de oportunidades de los consejeros de seguridad en el mercado de trabajo europeo.
translated_text: Secondly, with this directive we aim to: a) increase safety in the transport and transhipment of dangerous goods; b) reduce distortions of competition resulting from the existence of very different national training and cost structures; and c) establish equal opportunities for safety advisors on the European labour market.
reference_text: Secondly, by adopting this directive we achieve a) an increase in safety when dangerous goods are both transported and transhipped; b) a reduction in distortions of competition resulting from wide variations in national training structures and training costs and c) equal opportunities for safety advisers on the European labour market.

source_text: En segundo lugar: con esta directiva pretendemos: a) aumentar la seguridad tanto en el transporte como en el transbordo de mercancías peligrosas; b)reducir las distorsiones de la competencia que se siguen de la existencia de muy diferentes estructuras nacionales de formación y de costes, así como c) establecer la igualdad de oportunidades de los consejeros de seguridad en el mercado de trabajo europeo.
translated_text: Secondly, this directive aims to: a) increase safety in both the transport and transhipment of dangerous goods; b) reduce distortions of competition resulting from the existence of very different national training and cost structures; and c) establish equal opportunities for safety advisors in the European labour market.
reference_text: Secondly, by adopting this directive we achieve a) an increase in safety when dangerous goods are both transported and transhipped; b) a reduction in distortions of competition resulting from wide variations in national training structures and training costs and c) equal opportunities for safety advisers on the European labour market.

translated_text: Secondly: with this directive we aim to: a) increase safety in the transport and transfer of dangerous goods; b) reduce competition distortions resulting from the existence of very different national training structures and costs, as well as c) establish equal opportunities for safety advisors in the European labour market.
reference_text: Secondly, by adopting this directive we achieve a) an increase in safety when dangerous goods are both transported and transhipped; b) a reduction in distortions of competition resulting from wide variations in national training structures and training costs and c) equal opportunities for safety advisers on the European labour market.

source_text: En tercer lugar, con la directiva, tal como se presenta ahora como posición común y, en especial, puesto que se limita exclusivamente a normas mínimas, garantizamos un alto grado de flexibilidad y una reducida reglamentación por parte de la Unión Europea, contribuyendo así a incrementar en alto grado la autorresponsabilidad de los Estados miembros.
translated_text: Thirdly, with the directive as it is now presented as a common position, and especially as it is limited exclusively to minimum standards, we are guaranteeing a high degree of flexibility and reduced regulation on the part of the European Union, thus contributing to a high degree of increased self-responsibility on the part of the Member States.
reference_text: Thirdly, this directive, as it currently stands in the common position, guarantees - in particular because it confines itself exclusively to minimum standards - a high degree of flexibility and modest regulation by the European Union; by adopting it we contribute to the Member States' bearing a high level of individual responsibility.

translated_text: Thirdly, with the directive, as it now stands as a common position and, in particular, since it is limited exclusively to minimum standards, we guarantee a high degree of flexibility and reduced regulation by the European Union, thus contributing to a significant increase in the self-responsibility of the Member States.

translated_text: Thirdly, with the directive, as it is now presented as a common position and, in particular, since it is limited exclusively to minimum standards, we ensure a high degree of flexibility and reduced regulation by the European Union, thus contributing to a high degree of autonomy of the Member States.

source_text: Han sido aceptadas, se han puesto en práctica adecuadamente o no se han asumido porque no se aceptaron las correspondientes regulaciones europeas, por ejemplo, un sistema de sanciones para los casos de transgresión o una complicada constitución de bloques de cuestiones.
translated_text: Have they been accepted, have they been adequately implemented or have they not been taken on board because the corresponding European regulations were not accepted, e.g. a system of sanctions for cases of transgression or a complicated constitution of issue blocks.
reference_text: They have either been accepted or transposed with no change in the substance, or they have been rejected because the corresponding European arrangements have not been included, for example a system of penalties for violations of the rules or a complex classification structure for related groups of questions.
